Google releases security updates to fix CVE-2024-0519, the first Chrome zero-day vulnerability exploited in the wild since the start of the year.
Citrix urged customers to immediately patch Netscaler ADC and Gateway appliances exposed online against CVE-2023-6548 and CVE-2023-6549, two actively exploited zero-day vulnerabilities.
Kansas State University (K-State) announces it is managing a cybersecurity incident that has disrupted certain network systems.
The National Bank of Angola discloses to have suffered a cyber attack.
Reporters Without Borders (RSF) announces to have found traces of spyware resembling NSO group’s Pegasus surveillance tool on the phones of two journalists in Togo (Loïc Lawson and Anani Sossou).
Researchers from Netcraft discover an increased number of high-volume health product campaigns exploiting cheap top-level domains (TLDs), reaching up to 60% of a TLD’s daily domain registrations.
J.D. Gilmour files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access an employee’s email account.
Blockchain protocol Socket pauses some operations after a threat actor steals $3.3 million.

Researchers from Microsoft discover a new campaign from the Iranian-backed Mint Sandstom state hackers, targeting high-profile employees of research organizations and universities across Europe and the United States in spearphishing attacks pushing a new backdoor malware known as MediaPl.
A DDoS attack claimed by the pro-Russian group NoName057(16), temporarily disrupts access to a number of government websites, following Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky’s visit to Davos.

Researchers from Huntress reveal that ransomware actors are again using TeamViewer to gain initial access to organization endpoints and attempt to deploy encryptors based on the leaked LockBit ransomware builder.

Foxsemicon Integrated Technology, a subsidiary of Taiwanese electronics giant Foxconn, appears to have been targeted by the notorious LockBit ransomware group, which claims to have exfiltrated 5 Tb of data.
Clearview Resources, a Canadian energy producer, discloses details surrounding a cyberattack that incurred a financial setback of US$1.5 million for the company.
Researchers from Cyble uncover a new espionage campaign potentially targeting the Indian Air Force with the Go Stealer information-stealing malware.
Dawson James Securities files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access portions of the company’s computer network.
A new dataset named Naz.API contains 71 million email addresses from 1 billion credentials compiled using credential stuffing lists and data stolen by information-stealing malware.

Researchers from Cado Security discover a new campaign targeting vulnerable Docker services, deploying an XMRig miner and the 9hits viewer app on compromised hosts, allowing a dual monetization strategy.

Researchers Google TAG (Threat Analysis Group) reveal that the COLDRIVER Russian-backed hacking group is pushing Spica, a previously unknown backdoor malware using payloads masquerading as a PDF decryption tool.

CISA warns that CVE-2023-35082, a critical authentication bypass vulnerability in Ivanti's Endpoint Manager Mobile (EPMM) and MobileIron Core device management software (patched in August 2023) is now under active exploitation.
Researchers from Jamf discover a series of pirated macOS applications modified to communicate to attacker infrastructure, and hosted on Chinese pirating websites.
Researchers from Proofpoint identify a new phishing email campaign from TA866 after a hiatus of nine months.

Researchers from Trustwave warn of a "notable increase" in threat actor activity actively exploiting CVE-2023-46604, a now-patched flaw in Apache ActiveMQ to deliver the Godzilla web shell on compromised hosts.
Researchers from Trellix discover NS-STEALER, a new Java-based "sophisticated" information stealer that uses a Discord bot to exfiltrate sensitive data from compromised hosts.
Researchers from AhnLab reveal the details of a threat actor dubbed Mimo, exploiting multiple vulnerabilities to install coinminer and the Mimus ransomware.
column3: Multiple vulnerabilities (Log4Shell CVE-2021-44228, WSO2 CVE-2022-29464, Atlassian Confluence CVE-2022-26134, PaperCut CVE-2023–27350, Apache ActiveMQ CVE-2023-46604

column2: Threat actors stole about $7.5 million from the US Health Department, after accessing an HHS system that processes civilian grant payments.
The Akira ransomware operation claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Denham, a denim brand in the Netherlands. Fey days later the company confirms the cyber attack.
Researchers from Morphisec discover a campaign delivering a new version of the Chae$ malware employing advanced code polymorphism to bypass antivirus detection.
Community Memorial Healthcare (CMH) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party had accessed the company’s IT network.
Threat actors break into the medical records at Crace Medical Centre.
Security researchers at Blockfence uncover a scam responsible for creating more than 1,300 fraudulent crypto tokens since April 2023, swindling $32 million from 42,000 victims.
VMware confirms that CVE-2023-34048, a critical vCenter Server remote code execution vulnerability patched in October is now under active exploitation.
Researchers from Mandiant reveal that the UNC3886, a Chinese threat group, has been exploiting the CVE-2023-34048 critical vCenter Server vulnerability as a zero-day since at least late 2021.
Numerous Payoneer users in Argentina report waking up to find that their 2FA-protected accounts were hacked and funds stolen after receiving SMS OTP codes while they were sleeping.
Microsoft warns that some of its corporate email accounts were breached and data stolen by a Russian state-sponsored hacking group known as Midnight Blizzard.
Trezor issues a security alert after identifying a data breach due to unauthorized access to their third-party support ticketing portal.
Jason's Deli warns of a data breach in notifications sent to customers of its online platform stating that their personal data was exposed in credential stuffing attacks.
Veolia North America, a subsidiary of transnational conglomerate Veolia, discloses a ransomware attack that impacts systems part of its Municipal Water division and disrupts its bill payment systems.

Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal that the Parrot TDS (Traffic Distribution System) is still very active and its operators continue to work on making their JavaScript injections harder to detect and remove.
Researchers from Phylum discover 'oscompatible', a malicious package uploaded to the npm registry deploying a trojanized version of AnyDesk on compromised Windows machines.

Researchers from Zscaler discover a new campaign delivering the ZLoader (a.k.a. Terdot, DELoader, or Silent Night) malware, nearly two years after the botnet's infrastructure was dismantled in April 2022.
South Africa's railway agency (PRASA) discloses that it lost some 30.6 million rand (US$1.6 million) after the transport network fell victim to a phishing scam.
Canterbury City Council takes some of its public-facing systems offline due to an ongoing cybersecurity issue.
Dover District Council takes some of its public-facing systems offline due to an ongoing cybersecurity issue.
Thanet District Council takes some of its public-facing systems offline due to an ongoing cybersecurity issue.
Clackamas Community College suffers a cybersecurity incident and is forced to cancel all classes.

Researchers from AhnLab identify multiple instances of the SmokeLoader malware distributed to Ukrainian government entities and companies, including the Department of Justice, public institutions, insurance companies, medical institutions, construction companies, and manufacturing companies.
Researchers from Kroll observe an increased use of the malicious “SYSTEMBC” tool to maintain access in a compromised network.
Above Lending files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access LoanPro’s IT network.
First Financial Security (FFS) files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company was recently targeted in a ransomware attack.
Sirius Federal files a notice of data breach after discovering that files stored on the company’s IT network were subject to unauthorized access.
Columbus Regional Healthcare System (CRHS) files a notice of data breach after discovering that hackers were able to remove personal information from the company’s computer network.
Ashford files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized actor was able to access and acquire information stored on the company’s IT network.
Primary Health & Wellness Center provides a public notice of a ransomware incident.
In a phone message, a voice edited to sound like Biden urges voters in New Hampshire not to cast their ballots in Tuesday’s Democratic primary.
The LockBit ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to East Valley Institute of Technology.
The LockBit ransomware gang claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Pratt Institute.
A widespread Facebook phishing campaign leads unsuspecting users to a website that steals the Facebook credentials.
Finnish IT services and enterprise cloud hosting provider Tietoevry suffers an Akira ransomware attack impacting cloud hosting customers in one of its data centers in Sweden.
Sandwich chain Subway launches an investigation after the notorious LockBit ransomware group claims over the weekend that it hacked into the company’s systems and stole vast amounts of information.
Monobank, Ukraine’s largest mobile-only bank, is hit with a DDoS attack.
The Finham Park Multi Academy Trust suffers three ransomware attacks.
Researchers from Shadowserver are observing exploitation attempts for the CVE-2023-22527 remote code execution flaw vulnerability that affects outdated versions of Atlassian Confluence servers.

Researchers from Kaspersky discover a campaign where users are using a stealthy method to deliver to macOS users cryptowallet-stealing malware, named Activator, through DNS records that hide malicious scripts.
Apple releases security updates to address CVE-2024-23222, a zero-day vulnerability exploited in attacks that could impact iPhones, Macs, and Apple TVs.
Researchers from Sentinel One unveil a new campaign targeting media organizations and high-profile experts in North Korean affairs, orchestrated by the threat actor known as ScarCruft.

Researchers from Fortinet discover malicious packages on the open-source Python Package Index (PyPI) repository (nigpal, figflix, telerer, seGMM, fbdebug, sGMM, myGens, NewGends, and TestLibs111) that deliver an information stealing malware called WhiteSnake Stealer on Windows systems.
A threat actor named '9Near – Hacktivist' claims to leak 55 million records allegedly taken from the Thai Public Health Ministry’s Immunization Centre.
An individual known as Naraka lists a data dump for sale on breachforums.is, featuring one of Thailand's largest bookstores called Chula Book. The breach affects over 160,000 users.

The operators of the UFO Market on Telegram put on sale stolen data with 538,418 records featuring personal identifiable information (PII) of Thai individuals, encompassing details like citizens' ID card numbers.

A threat actor named R1g leaks the personal database of the Royal Thai Volunteers, containing 4.6 million of records with sensitive personal information such as names, citizen ID numbers, gender, birthdates, and addresses.

The operators of the UFO Market on Telegram put on sale a massive amount of data, specifically 3,149,330 records related to students, believed to have been illicitly obtained from the Basic Education Commission (OBEC).
The personal identifiable information (PII) primarily of elderly population in Thailand is leaked in a forum, with 690MB in size, containing 19,718,687 rows of data.
The Bangkok Industrial Gas Company Limited suffers a leak.
A threat actor named Ghostr leaks about 186GB of data with 5.3 million records from a stock trading platform.
A threat actor named Milw0rm leaks 61,000 rows of records related to Thai job seekers and includes an extensive range of personal information.
The threat actor named R1g leaks sensitive information pertaining to Thailand Navy Officers.

A threat actor named Soni posts a leaked database related to healthcare. The data breach consists of 25.5k records of user information including ID, user URL, encrypted passwords (phpass), user emails, login details, account status, display names, registration dates, and user activation keys.
Threat actors leak the personal identity details of officials and law enforcement personnel in Thailand, along with sensitive content.
A highly targeted phishing campaign named “My Slice” targets e-mail account holders of Italian organizations.
A thret actor with the nickname ‘roshtosh' leaks data from teenpatti.com, a gambling platform in India.
The same threat actor ‘roshtosh' leaks data from mpl.live (Mobile Premier League) another gambling platform in India.
The Douglas County Libraries is hit with a Play ransomware attack.
Researchers from Cyfirma identify a campaign carried out by a Pakistan-based trheat actor, targeting Indians with fake loan Android applications.

The Department of Health and Human Services' Health Sector Cybersecurity Coordination Center (HHS HC3) warns of attacks on healthcare sector firms that use ConnectWise's remote access tool ScreenConnect.
Carnegie Mellon University informs about 7,300 people that their personal information may have been compromised in an August cyber attack.

Researchers from Trend Micro reveal the details of 'Kasseika', a recently uncovered ransomware operation that employs Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver (BYOVD) tactics to disable antivirus software before encrypting files.

A threat actor with the moniker of 'emo' leaks the private emails of 15,115,516 Trello members, using an exposed Trello API to link private email addresses with Trello accounts, enabling the creation of millions of data profiles containing both public and private information.

Researchers from Infoblox reveal the details of 'VexTrio', a previously unknown traffic distribution system (TDS), active since at least 2017, aiding 60 affiliates in their cybercrime operations through a massive network of 70,000 sites.

Researchers from ReversingLabs discover warbeast2000 and kodiak2k, two malicious npm packages leveraging GitHub to store Base64-encrypted SSH keys stolen from developer systems on which they were installed.
Researchers from Arctic Wolf discover a new Go-based malware loader called CherryLoader, used to deliver additional payloads onto compromised hosts for follow-on exploitation.

Researchers from CSIRT-CTI reveal the details of two campaigns from the China-based threat actor known as Mustang Panda, targeting Myanmar's Ministry of Defence and Foreign Affairs as part of twin campaigns designed to deploy backdoors and remote access trojans.
Researchers from Broadcom discover a new ransomware family dubbed Frivinho.
Aircraft leasing giant AerCap confirms falling victim to ransomware after 'Slug', an emerging cybercrime gang claimed responsibility for the attack.
Southern Water confirms to have been hit with a Black Basta ransomware attack. The ransomware group claims to have stolen 750 Gb of files.
The National Investor, an Abu Dhabi-based investment management and advisory firm, warns that its name and logo are being used to advertise fraudulent investment opportunities.
Khaadi, a clothing retail site based in Pakistan and the United Arab Emirates is hit with a magecart attack.
Researchers from Blockaid discover a phishing attack where an attacker was able to leverage a vulnerability in email service provider Mailer Lite to impersonate web3 companies, draining $600k+

The Main Intelligence Directorate of Ukraine's Ministry of Defense claims that pro-Ukrainian hacktivists breached the Russian Center for Space Hydrometeorology, aka "Planeta" (планета), and wiped 2 petabytes of data.

New York-based global financial technology firm EquiLend says its operations have been disrupted after some systems were taken offline in a cyberattack. The LockBit ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.

Researchers from ESET reveal the details of a previously unknown advanced threat actor tracked as 'Blackwood', using a sophisticated malware called NSPX30 in cyberespionage attacks against companies and individuals.
The Kansas City Area Transportation Authority (KCATA) announces it was targeted by a ransomware attack. The Medusa ransomware operation claims responsibility for the attack.

Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) discloses that suspected Russian hackers known as Midnight Blizzard gained access to the company's Microsoft Office 365 email environment to steal data from its cybersecurity team and other departments.
Researchers from Itochu discover an updated version of a backdoor called LODEINFO, distributed via spear-phishing attacks, and used against targets in Japan from the Chinese threat actor APT10.

Researchers from Blackberry reveal that Mexican financial institutions are under the radar of a new spear-phishing campaign that delivers a modified version of an open-source remote access trojan called AllaKore RAT.
The UK's Caravan and Motorhome Club (CAMC) faces a suspected cyberattack with members reporting widespread IT outages for the past five days.
Bucks County, Pennsylvania is hit with a cybersecurity incident that knocks out the Emergency Communications’ Department’s computer-aided dispatch (CAD) system.
Another community in Pennsylvania — Washington County — also reports a cybersecurity incident. The county’s court system says it is “currently experiencing network outages.”
Researchers from Cyble identify an ongoing campaign targeting individuals seeking asylum in the United States through the use of MetaStealer malware.
Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign distributing the AsyncRAT (VenomRAT) disguised as a Korean company’s certificate, via malicious Office documents.
Sigrist, Cheek, Potter & Huyser (SCP&H) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party gained access to the company’s email system and cloud-based storage site.
Des Moines Orthopaedic Surgeons (DMOS) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized actor was able to access the company’s computer network.

Researchers from Wordfence detect malicious activity targeting a critical severity flaw (CVE-2023-6933) in the ‘Better Search Replace’ WordPress plugin, with thousands of attempts in the past 24 hours.

Microsoft reveals that the Russian state-sponsored threat actor Midnight Blizzard, responsible for a cyber attack on its systems in late November 2023, has been targeting other organizations and that it's currently beginning to notify them.
column3: >1 (Password Spray, Account takeover via malicious OAuth applications)

column2: Researchers from Malwarebytes reveal that Chinese-speaking users have been targeted by malicious Google ads for restricted messaging apps like Telegram as part of an ongoing malvertising campaign.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a new variant of the Phobos ransomware dubbed FAUST
Naftogaz, Ukraine's state-owned gas and oil company, is hit by a large-scale cyberattack.
Ukraine's state railway, Ukrzaliznytsia, confirms that some of its services are under attack, preventing some customers from buying tickets online
Ukrposhta, the Ukrainian postal service, is also it with a cyber attack.
Ukrtransbezpeka, an Ukrainian government agency providing transport and traffic security is hit with a cyber attack claimed by a Russian group known as the National Cyber Army.
Turkish hacktivists from MeshSec project political messages about the war in Gaza onto digital signage in an Israeli movie theater.
GC Services files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company was the target of a recent cyberattack.
Planet Home Lending files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company was recently the target of a ransomware attack.
Keenan & Associates sends notices of a data breach to 1.5 million customers, warning that threat actors accessed their personal information in a recent cyberattack.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a new ransomware family, written in Rust, dubbed Albabat.
The GALA Hispanic Theatre, a popular theater in Washington, D.C. has more than $250,000 in stolen funds returned after hackers managed to siphon the money out of their bank account.
Washington National Insurance Company files a notice of data breach after discovering that a senior officer was targeted in a SIM-swapping attack.
The Colombia office of US Aid Office, the U.S. government agency that oversees foreign aid and development funding says its Facebook page was hacked.
Somesing, a blockchain-based social karaoke platform in South Korea, suffers an exploit and loses 730 million of its native token SSX, which amounts to $11.58 million
Threat actors are actively exploiting CVE-2024-23897 and CVE-2024-23898, two critical vulnerabilities affecting Jenkins.
Researchers from Broadcom discover a new ransomware family dubbed NOOSE.
The Freehold Township School District informs its staff, families, and students that its schools and offices would be closed due to a cybersecurity incident.

The FBI issues a warning, following a surge of reports regarding criminals using couriers to collect cash or precious metals like gold or silver from victims (many senior citizens) whom the scammers instructed to sell their valuables.
Schneider Electric suffers a Cactus ransomware attack in the company's Sustainability Business division, leading to the theft of corporate data.
Researchers from Broadcom discover a new ransomware family dubbed DHC.
Researchers from Aqua Security discover an updated version of the malware HeadCrab, known to target Redis database servers across the world since early September 2021.
Fulton County discloses to have experienced a “widespread system outage”  during the weekend. A ransomware group claims responsibility for the attack.

Researchers from Resecurity discover over 1,572 compromised credentials from customers of RIPE, Asia-Pacific Network Information Centre (APNIC), the African Network Information Centre (AFRINIC), and the Latin America and Caribbean Network Information Center (LACNIC), resulting from infostealer infections.

The Network Contagion Research Institute (NCRI) reveals that teenagers from Western English-speaking countries are increasingly targeted by financial sextortion attacks conducted by Nigeria-based cybercriminals.
Researchers from Netenrich discover a new ransomware group called Alpha, recently emerging with the launch of its leak site on the Dark Web, featuring an initial listing of data from six victims.
The Ukrainian state agency overseeing the treatment of prisoners says that it had restored access to its website after being hit by a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack over the weekend.
OpenAI officials say that the ChatGPT histories a user reported result from his ChatGPT account being compromised.
The local region of Basilicata in Italy suffers a ransomware attack.
Researchers from Truesec’s uncover an Akira ransomware campaign exploiting an old Cisco ASA and FTD bug tracked as CVE-2020-3259.
The municipality of Teo in Spain, is hit with a ransomware attack.

Researchers from  AT&T Cybersecurity discover a new phishing campaign abusing Microsoft Teams group chat requests to push malicious attachments that install the DarkGate malware payloads on victims' systems.

Researchers from Mandiant reveal the details of UNC4990, a financially motivated threat actor using USB devices for initial infection, and abusing legitimate online platforms, including GitHub, GitLab, Vimeo, and Ars Technica, to host encoded payloads embedded in seemingly benign content.
Researchers from CloudSEK discover a massive database containing the information of roughly 750 million mobile subscribers in India offered for sale on the dark web.

Threat actors breach the database of the Romanian Chamber of Deputies, the lower house of the Parliament, reportedly managing to obtain confidential information, such as the prime minister’s identity documents, medical analyses, and other personal data.

Global Affairs Canada suffers a cyber attack and says an "unplanned IT outage" is affecting remote access to its network, activated intentionally to "address the discovery of malicious cyber activity."
Researchers from K7 Security Labs discover a new ransomware variant written in Python.

Researchers from Proofpoint identify the return of TA576, a cybercriminal threat actor that uses tax-themed lures specifically targeting accounting and finance organizations, in the attempt to deliver remote access trojans (RATs).
Researchers from AhnLab discover a new activity of the Trigona ransomware threat actor installing Mimic ransomware.

Saint Anthony Hospital files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to gain access to the organization’s IT network. The LockBit ransomware group claims responsibility for the attack.
Krystal BioTech (Krystal) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential information that had been entrusted to the company.
Vail-Summit Orthopaedics & Neurosurgery (VSON) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party attempted to infiltrate the company’s computer network.
Bankers Life and Casualty Company files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access personal information that had been entrusted to the company.
Ivanti warns of CVE-2024-21893, a vulnerability impacting Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA gateways, under active exploitation.
CISA warns that CVE-2022-48618, a patched kernel security flaw affecting Apple iPhones, Macs, TVs, and watches is now being actively exploited in attacks.
The FBI disrupts the KV-botnet used by Chinese Volt Typhoon state hackers to evade detection during attacks targeting U.S. critical infrastructure.
The Computer Emergency Response Team in Ukraine (CERT-UA) warns about a PurpleFox (a.k.a. 'DirtyMoe') malware campaign that has infected at least 2,000 computers in the country.

Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that the Russian state-sponsored actors from Pawn Storm have staged NT LAN Manager (NTLM) v2 hash relay attacks through various methods from April 2022 to November 2023, targeting high-value targets worldwide.
Threat actors steal around $112 million worth of the Ripple-focused cryptocurrency XRP from a crypto wallet belonging to the Ripple’s co-founder and executive chairman Chris Larsen.
Lurie Children’s Hospital suffers a network outage, later confirmed to be a ransomware attack by the Rhysida group demanding a $3.4M ransom.

Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a large-scale campaign called ApateWeb that uses a network of over 130,000 domains to deliver scareware, potentially unwanted programs (PUPs) and other scam pages.
Researchers from Malwarebytes reveal the details of a Nitrogen campaign hosting their payloads on compromised WordPress sites, many of which are already hacked with malicious PHP shell scripts.

The IntelBroker group claims responsibility for a potential cyberattack on a popular (undisclosed) mobile banking app boasting over 10 million users. The threat actor posts details of the exploit on a hacker forum. Nu Bank might be the undisclosed target of the cyberattack.
Crescent Community Health Center (CCHC) files a notice of data breach after discovering that information that had been provided to the company was subject to unauthorized access.
Encore Bank files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to gain access to an employee’s email account.
Emmanuel College files a notice of data breach after discovering that a cybersecurity incident affected the personal information of nearly 90k individuals.
The National Board of Osteopathic Medical Examiners (NBOME) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access the organization’s IT network.
Researchers from ESET discover 12 malicious apps infected with the VajraSpy remote access tool by the India-linked Patchwork APT.

Cloudflare discloses that its internal Atlassian server was breached by a suspected 'nation state attacker' who accessed its Confluence wiki, Jira bug database, and Bitbucket source code management system using auth tokens stolen in the Okta attack.
An international law enforcement operation code-named 'Synergia' has takes down over 1,300 command and control servers used in ransomware, phishing, and malware campaigns.

Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) is investigating a potential new breach after a threat actor put allegedly stolen data up for sale on a hacking forum, claiming it contains HPE credentials and other sensitive information.
Bank of America warns customers of a data breach exposing their personal information after Infosys McCamish Systems (IMS), one of its service providers, was hacked last year.

A joint forensic investigation by Access Now, the Citizen Lab at the Munk School of Global Affairs at the University of Toronto (the Citizen Lab), and local partners uncover that at least 35 individuals in Jordan have been targeted with Israeli firm NSO Group’s Pegasus spyware.
Threat actors working for Russia’s intelligence services are impersonating researchers and academics in an ongoing campaign to gain access to their colleagues’ email accounts.
Researchers at Akamai discover a variant of FritzFrog, a long-running botnet, now abusing the Log4Shell CVE-2021-44228 vulnerability.

Homeland Justice, an Iran-linked hacking group with a history of targeting Albanian state agencies and businesses says that it was behind an attack on the country’s Institute of Statistics (INSTAT), which is responsible for census information and other official statistics.
The Municipality of Sant Antoni de Portmany in the Island of Ibiza, suffers a ransomware attack.
Researchers from Cado Security reveal that exposed Docker API endpoints over the internet are under assault from a sophisticated cryptojacking campaign called Commando Cat.
Researchers at Check Point discover a surge in cyberattacks involving fake voicemails distributing malware.
Knight Barry Title files a notice of data breach after discovering that a recent cyberattack resulted in threat actors being able to access the company’s computer network.
Anonymous Sudan claims responsibility for a DDOS attack against the UAE’s Flydubai Airline.
The Beaumont ISD phone system is back online following a ransomware attack.
AnyDesk confirms that it suffered a recent cyberattack that allowed threat actors to gain access to the company's production systems.
Government agencies in the Philippines announce they had repelled a cyberattack from threat actors suspected to be based in China.
Tennessee's Germantown announces a ransomware attack.

Researchers from Securonix reveal the details of the STEADY#URSA campaign, an ongoing operation carried on by the russia-linked APT group Shuckworm (aka Gamaredon, and Primitive Bear, targeting the Ukrainian military with a new PowerShell backdoor called Subtle-Paws
The North Carolina Housing Finance Agency (NCHFA) loses nearly $3 million in a business email compromise (BEC) scam.
Researchers from Palo Alto discover a new spike of activity attributed to Mispadu Stealer.
Fairway Independent Mortgage Corporation (Fairway) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized user had accessed a third-party system utilized by Fairway.
Spectrum Vision Partners (SVP) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access the company’s computer network.
Sage Home Loans Corporation files a notice of data breach after discovering that it was the recent victim of a ransomware attack.
The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for ransomware attack to BrightStar Care. The same day another group Sieged Sec claims to have breached the same organization.
Groton Public Schools is the victim of a cyber attack.
Threat monitoring service Shadowserver reports multiple attackers leveraging the Ivanti CVE-2024-21893 vulnerability, with 170 distinct IP addresses attempting to exploit the flaw.
Pennsylvania’s court system is hit with a distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack and experiences disruptions.
Scammers steal HK$200 million (roughly $25,5 million) from a multi-national company using a deepfake conf call to trick an employee into transferring the funds.
Student rideshare startup HopSkipDrive confirms a data breach involving the personal data of more than 155,000 drivers.
A government source reveals that classified Japanese diplomatic documents were leaked after a Chinese cyberattacks on the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
Northern Light Health is hit with a cyber attack.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a campaign distributing a Python infostealer via a malicious Excel document.
State Street files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access confidential information in the company’s possession.

Researchers from Group-IB reveal the details of a threat group named 'ResumeLooters' has stolen the personal data of over two million job seekers after compromising 65 legitimate job listing and retail sites using SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
French healthcare services firm Viamedis suffers a cyberattack that exposed the data of policyholders and healthcare professionals in the country.

The municipality of Korneuburg in Austria says it was hit by a LockBit ransomware attack, leading to funerals reportedly being canceled and the town hall informing residents its staff can only be reached via telephone.
Service Employees International Union (SEIU) Local 1000, one of the largest unions in California, confirms that it is dealing with network disruptions due to a LockBit ransomware attack.
Researchers from Google's Threat Analysis Group discover a campaign targeting iPhone users in Indonesia via a spyware developed by the Spanish company Variston.

Medical Management Resource Group d/b/a/ American Vision Partners (American Vision Partners or MMRG) files a notice of data breach after discovering that the company experienced a cyberattack. 2.3 million Eyecare patients are affected.
Explicit comments about school children are sent to their parents in an apparent hack of Class Charts, a classroom app.
TIC Hosting, a hosting provider in Romania, suffers a data breach affecting 300 customers.
iTITAN Hosting, another hosting provider in Romania, suffers a data breach.

French healthcare services firm Almerys also suffers a cyberattack that exposed the data of policyholders and healthcare professionals in the country. The combination of the two breaches compromises the information of 33 million individuals.

A joint advisory from CISA, the NSA, the FBI, and partner Five Eyes agencies reveal that the Chinese Volt Typhoon cyber-espionage group infiltrated a critical infrastructure network in the United States and remained undetected for at least five years before being discovered.
Researchers from Trustwave discover a new password-stealing malware named Ov3r_Stealer, spreading through fake job advertisements on Facebook, aiming to steal account credentials and cryptocurrency.
LastPass warns that a fake copy of its app is being distributed on the Apple App Store, likely used as a phishing app to steal users' credentials.
Researchers from McAfee discover a new version of the XLoader (a.k.a. MoqHao) Android malware that automatically executes on devices it infects, requiring no user interaction to launch.
Researchers from Check Point report an uptick in Raspberry Robin's malware operations starting October 2023, with large attack waves targeting systems worldwide.
The U.S. CISA adds CVE-2023-4762, a Google Chromium V8 Type Confusion bug, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
Researchers from Crowdstrike discover a HijackLoader (a.k.a. IDAT Loader) variant that employs sophisticated evasion techniques.

Researchers from S2W discover a Go language-based information-stealing malware distributed from a security program download page, dubbed Troll Stealer, attributed to the Kimsuky North Korean threat actor and targeting users in South Korea.
Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign distributing a RAT malware masquerading as illicit gambling-related content.
Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a malvertising campaign on Facebook distributing malware through a fatal accident scam and now spreading to Germany.
Car maker Hyundai Motor Europe suffers a Black Basta ransomware attack, with the threat actors claiming to have stolen three terabytes of corporate data.
Fortinet warns that CVE-2024-21762, a new critical remote code execution vulnerability in FortiOS SSL VPN is potentially being exploited in attacks.

Researchers from Bitdefender discover a new Rust-based macOS malware, named Rustdoor, spreading as a Visual Studio update to provide backdoor access to compromised systems, using the infrastructure linked to the infamous ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang.

Researchers from Orange Cyberdefense reveal that threat actors are exploiting the CVE-2024-21893 server-side request forgery (SSRF) vulnerability in Ivanti Connect Secure, Policy Secure, and ZTA gateways to deploy the new DSLog backdoor on vulnerable devices.
Researchers from Cisco Talos disclose a stealthy cyberespionage campaign that targeted a non-profit organization in Saudi Arabia with a backdoor named Zardoor, and remained undetected for two years.
Researchers from Kaspersky discover a novel banking Trojan dubbed "Coyote," hunting for credentials for 61 different online banking applications in Brazil.
Researchers from Check Point warn of scammers using fake giveaways to steal credentials with 800 new ‘Temu’ domains registered in the past 3 months.
Anti-Zionist hacktivists publish the names, images, professions and social media accounts of hundreds of Jewish people working in academia and creative industries.

The Military Intelligence and Security Service (MIVD) of the Netherlands revels that a Chinese cyber-espionage group breached the Dutch Ministry of Defence and deployed the COATHANGER malware on compromised devices exploiting the CVE-2022-42475 vulnerability targeting Fortinet devices.
The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) says Americans lost over $10 billion to scammers in 2023.
Security Researchers warn that exploitation of  CVE-2024-22024, a recently disclosed XML external entity (XXE) vulnerability impacting Ivanti enterprise VPN and network access products has commenced

Aircraft parts dealer Willis Lease Finance Corporation (WLFC) informs the US Securities and Exchange Commission that it fell victim to a cyberattack. The Black Basta ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
Threat actors are believed to have used a stolen private key to mint and steal over 1.79 billion PLA tokens, a cryptocurrency used within the PlayDapp ecosystem.
Researchers from K7 detect a resurgence of the .tprc ransomware.
Signature Performance files a notice of data breach after learning that an unauthorized party was able to access the company’s IT network.

Grace Lutheran Foundation, d/b/a Grace Lutheran Communities posts a notice about a data breach discovered on January 22, 2024. The same day the ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
The Armentières Hospital Center is the victim of a ransomware attack.
100 hospitals across Romania take their systems offline after a Backmydata ransomware attack hits their healthcare management system.
CISA warns that CVE-2023-43770, a Roundcube email server vulnerability patched in September is now actively exploited in cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
Researchers from Proofpoint reveal the details of a phishing campaign that has compromised hundreds of user accounts in dozens of Microsoft Azure environments, including those of senior executives.
Researchers from Resecurity identify a data leak of 6,453,254 Israeli voter records due to the breach of Elector, an Israeli software application used to manage political campaigns.
The group known as R00Tk1T CYBER TEAM releases a JSON dump with 90,000 voters from the past Parliamentary Elections in Lebanon.
SiegedSec and ByteMeCrew exploit a vulnerability and access the data collected from the TheTruthSpy stalkwerware.

Researchers from Sentinel One reveal the details of a media campaign, orchestrated by China, alleging US hacking operations, following condemnation from the US, UK and EU in July 2021 over Chinese cyber activities.
Researchers from Palo Alto discover a new campaign carried out via the Glupteba modular malware.

The French Ministry for Europe and Foreign Affairs accuses Russia of running a disinformation campaign through a network of 193 websites, aimed at disseminating Russian disinformation, targeting Kyiv's Western allies ahead of the second anniversary of Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.
Researchers from EclecticIQ observe cybercriminals increasing the delivery of the DarkGate loader following the FBI's takedown of Qakbot infrastructure.
Researchers from Zscaler discover a new campaign delivering the Pikabot malware downloader.
Researchers from Resecurity identify an individual who claimed to be selling a 21.58 database containing information about 24.3 million Iraqi citizens.
SinglePoint Outsourcing (SinglePoint) files a notice of data breach discovering that an unauthorized party had accessed its computer network.
Coleman Professional Services (Coleman Health Services, Coleman) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed several employee email accounts.
A ransomware attack on the Office of the Colorado State Public Defender forces the agency to shut down its computer network.
MSH International Canada, the insurance provider for members of the Public Service Health Care Plan who are posted abroad or travelling, says it recently detected a “cybersecurity incident”.
The Danbury School District confirms to have been hit with a ransomware attack.
The city of Coeur d'Alene announces it had detected malware in its computer network.
Researchers from Proofpoint reveal that the Bumblebee malware has returned after a four-month vacation, targeting thousands of organizations in the United States in phishing campaigns.

Prudential Financial discloses that its network was breached, with the attackers stealing employee and contractor data before being blocked from compromised systems. Few days later the ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
The IntelBroker threat actor leals 200,000 records on a hacker forum, claiming they contain the mobile phone numbers, email addresses, and other personal information of Facebook Marketplace users.

Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that the APT group Water Hydra has been exploiting the Microsoft Defender SmartScreen vulnerability (CVE-2024-21412) in its campaigns targeting financial market traders.
Battery maker VARTA AG announces that it was targeted by a cyberattack that forced it to shut down IT systems, causing production to stop at its plants.
Researchers from Sophos discover fresh Qbot activity, with up to 10 new malware builds emerging since mid-December.
Poland’s new prime minister Donald Tusk says that he has uncovered documents which “confirm 100%” that the prior administration illegally deployed Pegasus spyware, according to local news reports.

Researchers from Volexity link the Iranian-origin threat actor known as Charming Kitten to a new set of attacks aimed at Middle East policy experts with a new backdoor called BASICSTAR by creating a fake webinar portal.
Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign leveraging tools like "smtp-validator" and "Email to SMS" to deploy Revenge RAT.
Garon Products is hit with a ThreeAM ransomware attack.

The Government Accountability Office warns of a breach resulting in the compromise of data associated with thousands of current and former employees. The attack was carried out exploiting the CVE-2023-22515 Atlassian vulnerability from one of its contractors, CGI Federal.
Jeff Wyler Automotive Family (Jeff Wyler) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access its computer network.
Bradford-Scott Data (Bradford-Scott) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party accessed, and may have copied,  files from the company’s computer network.
Trans-Northern Pipelines (TNPI) confirms its internal network was breached in November 2023 and that it's now investigating claims of data theft made by the ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang.
Microsoft warns that CVE-2024-21410, a critical vulnerability in Exchange Server was exploited as a zero-day before being fixed during this month's Patch Tuesday.

The FBI takes down a botnet of small office/home office (SOHO) Ubiquiti routers used by Russia's Main Intelligence Directorate of the General Staff (GRU) to proxy malicious traffic and to target the United States and its allies in spearphishing and credential theft attacks.

Researchers from Trellix reveal that the RansomHouse ransomware operation has created a new tool named 'MrAgent' that automates the deployment of its data encrypter across multiple VMware ESXi hypervisors.
South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol’s office discloses that presumed North Korean threat actors breached the personal emails of one of his staff members ahead of Yoon’s trip to Europe in November.
Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a phishing campaign leveraging the AnyDesk remote desktop application to target employees.

The South Korea's National Intelligence Service (NIS) warns that a North Korean IT organization known as "Gyeongheung", affiliated with the secretive Office 39, is selling gambling websites pre-infected with malware to South Korean cyber crime organizations.
Researchers from Cyble discover a new Go-based ransomware dubbed JKwerlo targeting victims in France and Spain.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a series of malware droppers dubbed the “TicTacToe dropper,” utilized to deliver various malicious payloads to victims.
The U.S. CISA adds CVE-2024-21351, a Microsoft Windows SmartScreen Security feature bypass vulnerability, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
Davlyn Investments Property Management files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party was able to access its IT network.
Lexington Medical Center files a notice of data breach discovering that an unauthorized actor was able to access an employee’s email account.
Superior Communications files a notice of data breach after discovering that certain files on the company’s computer network were removed by an unauthorized party.
Tax Favored Benefits (TFB) files a notice of data breach after discovering that an unauthorized party had gained access to an employee’s email account.
Anonymous Sudan claims responsibility for targeting ChatGPT and its parent company, OpenAI, with a series of DDoS attacks.

Researchers from Group-IB discover a new iOS and Android trojan named 'GoldPickaxe', which employs a social engineering scheme to trick victims into scanning their faces and ID documents, which are believed to be used to generate deepfakes for unauthorized banking access.

Researchers from Cisco Talos and CERT.NGO discover a new malware dubbed TinyTurla-NG and TurlaPower-NG used by the Russian hacker group Turla to maintain access to a target’s network and to steal sensitive data.
Ukraine's cyber police arrests a 31-year-old for running a cybercrime operation that gained access to bank accounts of American and Canadian users and sold them on the dark web.
PSI Software SE, a German software developer for complex production and logistics processes suffers a ransomware attack that impacts its internal infrastructure.
The U.S. conduct a cyberattack against MV Behshad, an Iranian military ship that had been collecting intelligence on cargo vessels in the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden.

The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) and the Multi-State Information Sharing & Analysis Center (MS-ISAC) reveal that a threat actor gained access to a US government organization’s network using the compromised credentials for a former employee’s administrative account.
The EU Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-EU) reveals that organizations based in the EU are being targeted by spear phishing campaigns leveraging EU political and diplomatic events.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a malicious sample posing as a legitimate crypto wallet including the SpyNote RAT with several interesting additions related to anti-analysis and cryptocurrencies.
Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a massive utility scam campaign spreading via online ads.
Meta removes a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to an Italian surveillance-for-hire company Cy4Gate used to collect intelligence about their victims.
Meta takes down a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to an Italian spyware firm called RCS Labs owned by Cy4Gate.
Meta removes a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to an Italian surveillance-for-hire firm, IPS Intelligence,

Meta takes down a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to a Spanish spyware firm called Variston IT, its Italian subsidiary and exploit developer TrueL IT, and a UAE-based firm called Protect Electronic Systems.
Meta takes down a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to a UAE-based firm called Protect Electronic Systems.
Meta takes down a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to Italian spyware irm Negg Group.

Meta removes a network of accounts on Facebook and Instagram linked to a Spanish firm, Mollitiam Industries, that advertises a data collection service and spyware targeting Windows, MacOS and Android.
Meta removes 33 Facebook accounts, six Pages, six Groups, and four Instagram accounts originating from China for violating the policy against coordinated inauthentic behavior.
Meta removes 381 Facebook accounts, 88 Pages and 19 Groups originating from Myanmar, for violating the policy against coordinated inauthentic behavior, targeting domestic audiences in that country.

Meta removes 1,020 Facebook accounts, five Pages, two Groups and 711 Instagram accounts originating from Ukraine, for violating the policy against coordinated inauthentic behavior, targeting domestic audiences in Ukraine and Kazakhstan.

Researchers from Sentinel One discover a campaign where threat actors employed AWS Simple Notification Service (SNS) and the SNS Sender script to send SMS messages impersonating the US Postal Service.
Virginia Farm Bureau (VFB) files a notice of data breach after the company’s IT system was targeted in a ransomware attack.
A West Orange town council meeting is “Zoom bombed” by outsiders making racist and antisemitic statements.

Researchers from Recorded Future uncover a campaign carried out by TAG-70, a threat actors operating with interests aligned to Belarus and Russia that likely exploited cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in CVE-2023-43770 Roundcube webmail servers to target over 80 organizations.
Researchers from Cisco reveal the details of Agniane Stealer, an information-stealing malware mainly targeting the cryptocurrency wallets of its victims.
Russian hackers attacked several popular Ukrainian media outlets, posting fake news related to the war.
"Hostile elements" attempt to take over the communication network of an El Al plane flying from Phuket to Ben-Gurion Airport and divert it from its destination.
Researchers from ThreatFabric discover five campaigns of the Anatsa banking trojan aimed at users in the UK, Germany, Spain, Slovakia, Slovenia, and the Czech Republic.

Researchers from Patchstack reveal that threat actors are actively exploiting CVE-2024-25600, a critical remote code execution (RCE) flaw impacting the Bricks Builder Theme to run malicious PHP code on vulnerable sites.

Germany's federal intelligence agency (BfV) and South Korea's National Intelligence Service (NIS) warn of an ongoing cyber-espionage operation targeting the global defense sector on behalf of the North Korean government.
Germany's federal intelligence agency (BfV) and South Korea's National Intelligence Service (NIS) warn that Lazarus group's "Operation Dream Job," was also used against the defense sector.
Researchers from Resecurity identify an increasing trend of cryptocurrency counterfeiting, with several tokens impersonating major brands, government organizations and national fiat currencies.
The University of Cambridge is hit with a DDoS attack. The Anonymous Sudan group claims responsibility for the attack.
The University of Manchester is hit with a DDoS attack. The Anonymous Sudan group claims responsibility for the attack.
FixedFloat, a decentralized crypto exchange, is hacked via a crypto drainer, for at least $26 million worth of Bitcoin and Ethereum.
Researchers at Cado Security discover a new campaign targeting Redis servers on Linux hosts using a piece of malware called ‘Migo’ to mine for cryptocurrency.
Researchers from Sysdig reveal that a threat actor is using an open-source network mapping tool named SSH-Snake to look for private keys undetected and move laterally on the victim infrastructure.
Researchers from Cisco Talos warn of hackers abusing the Google Cloud Run service to distribute massive volumes of banking trojans like Astaroth, Mekotio, and Ousaban.
Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new campaign carried out by the Earth Preta group, using a customized PlugX malware variant named DOPLUGS.

Researchers from ReversingLabs discover NP6HelperHttptest and NP6HelperHttper, two malicious packages on the Python Package Index (PyPI) repository that were found leveraging a technique called DLL side-loading to circumvent detection by security software and run malicious code.
Researchers from Phylum discover a set of fake npm packages on the Node.js repository linked with North Korean state-sponsored actors.

China's Ministry of Industry and Information Technology warns local netizens that fake wallet apps for the nation's central bank digital currency (CBDC) are already circulating and being abused by scammers.
Researchers from eSentire observe the threat actor known as Blind Eagle using a loader malware called Ande Loader to deliver remote access trojans (RATs) like Remcos RAT and NjRAT.
A day after ScreenConnect publishes the security issues affecting its products, attackers start leveraging the vulnerabilities in attacks.

Healthcare giant UnitedHealth Group confirms that its subsidiary Optum is forced to shut down IT systems and various services after a cyberattack by “nation-state” hackers on the Change Healthcare platform. The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
Researchers from ESET discover Operation Texonto, a new influence operation targeting Ukraine that leverages spam emails to propagate war-related disinformation.

Researchers from ESET discover a spearphishing campaign targeting a Ukrainian defense company in October 2023 and an EU agency in November 2023. The goal of both was to steal credentials for Microsoft Office 365 accounts.
Researchers from Group-IB uncover VietCredCare, a previously unknown information stealer targeting Facebook advertisers in Vietnam.

Researchers from DCSO reveal that an installer for 'Statistika KZU' (Cтатистика КЗУ), a tool likely used by the Russian Consular Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MID) has been backdoored to deliver a remote access trojan called Konni RAT (a.k.a. UpDog).
Australian telecommunications provider Tangerine announces that the personal information of 230,000 individuals was stolen in a recent cyberattack.

Researchers from Aqua unveil a new campaign targeting Apache big-data stack, specifically Apache Hadoop and Apache Druid, exploits existing misconfigurations and vulnerabilities to enslave them in the Lucifer botnet.
Chinese PC maker Acemagic admits that some of its products shipped with pre-installed malware.
Researches from Sucuri discover a surge in attacks by Angel Drainer, a novel form of website malware targeting Web3 and cryptocurrency assets.
Maryville, which operates several addiction recovery centers around South Jersey, announces it was the victim of a data breach that accessed Social Security numbers and other personal information,
The U.S. CISA adds CVE-2024-1709 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog.

Researchers from Sophos reveal that threat actors are deploying the buhtiRansom LockBit ransomware variant on victims' systems after gaining access using exploits targeting the CVE-2024-1708 and CVE-2024-1709 ScreenConnect vulnerabilities.
U-Haul starts informing customers that a threat actor used stolen account credentials to access an internal system for dealers and team members to track customer reservations.

Researchers from Phylum discover that a dormant package named django-log-tracker, available on the Python Package Index (PyPI) repository was updated nearly after two years to propagate an information stealer malware called Nova Sentinel.

Chinese police are investigating an unauthorized and highly unusual online dump of documents from  I-Soon, a private security contractor linked to the nation’s top policing agency and other parts of its government.
Researchers from Uptycs discover a campaign exploiting multiple vulnerabilities, including CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2022-26134, to mine cryptocurrencies.
column3: Multiple vulnerabilities including CVE-2021-44228 and CVE-2022-26134

column2: A joint effort by SentinelLabs and ClearSky Cyber Security uncover a significant propaganda and disinformation campaign, possibly orchestrated by the Russia-aligned influence operation network called Doppelgänger.
A new ransomware threat dubbed M.O.R.E (Multi OS Ransomware Executable), emerges in the dark web.
Researchers from Cofense discover a campaign delivering the Rhadamanthys stealer to targets in the Oil and Gas industry.
Bimbo Bakeries USA, the U.S. branch of baking giant Grupo Bimbo suffers a ransomware attack by the Medusa ransomware group.
The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP), Canada's national police force, discloses that it recently faced a cyber attack targeting its networks.

Steel giant ThyssenKrupp confirms that threat actors breached systems in its Automotive division, forcing them to shut down IT systems as part of its response and containment effort. Few days later the company confirms a ransomware attack.

Researchers from Wordfence disclose CVE-2024-1071, a critical security flaw  in a popular WordPress plugin called Ultimate Member that has more than 200,000 active installations and it's currently under active exploration.

Researchers from Cyfirma discover Xeno RAT, an "intricately designed" remote access trojan available on GitHub, making it easily accessible to other actors at no extra cost, and already distributed in campaigns via the Discord CDN.
Jeff “Jihoz” Zirlin, one of the co-founders of the video game Axie Infinity and the related Ronin Network has nearly $10 million in cryptocurrency stolen from personal accounts.
IntelBroker claims to have breached the database of the Los Angeles Airport, exploiting a vulnerability in the CRM system, and resulting in the compromise of 2.5 million records of plane owners.
The Malawi government reportedly suspends issuing passports for the past two weeks due to what appears to be a ransomware attack on the immigration service's computer network.
medQ files a notice of data breach after discovering that hackers accessed and encrypted a software platform used by medQ.

Researchers from AhnLab discover a new campaign carried out by the Korean Kimsuky distributing the TrollAgent malware disguised as security programs on a Korean construction-related association's website.
Threat actors are exploiting FCKeditor, a CMS editor discontinued 14 years ago, to compromise education and government entities worldwide to poison search results with malicious sites or scams.

Researchers from at Guardio Labs discover a massive ad fraud campaign named "SubdoMailing", using over 8,000 legitimate internet domains and 13,000 subdomains to send up to five million emails per day to generate revenue through scams and malvertising.
Members of the Five Eyes (FVEY) intelligence alliance warn that APT29 Russian Foreign Intelligence Service (SVR) threat actors are now switching to attacks targeting their victims' cloud services.

Researchers from Morphisec discover a  group tracked as 'UAC-0184' observed utilizing steganographic image files to deliver the Remcos remote access trojan (RAT) onto the systems of a Ukrainian entity operating in Finland.

The Hessen Consumer Center in Germany is hit with a ransomware attack, causing IT systems to shut down and temporarily disrupting its availability. The ALPHV/BlackCat ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
An open redirect vulnerability in the remains of Google Web Light service, is actively exploited in multiple phishing campaigns.
The Akira ransomware group claims responsibility for a cyber attack to Quik Pawn Shop.
Das Team Ag, a job placement agency with 25 branches across Switzerland and the Principality of Liechtenstein, confirms that they fell victim to a cyberattack by the Black Basta ransomware group.
Researchers from Trend Micro discover a new campaign that used Chinese-Taiwanese relations as a social engineering lure to infect selected targets.
Researchers from Forcepoint discover a campaign targeting organizations in the travel industry with the Agent Tesla malware.
Researchers from AhnLab discover Nood RAT, a Gh0st RAT variant for Linux, being utilized in malware campaigns aiming to steal sensitive data from Linux servers.

The social media account on X, formerly Twitter, of MicroStrategy falls victim to a hacking incident, resulting in the posting of malicious links related to a phony airdrop for an ethereum-based crypto token. The scam causes losses exceeding $440,000.
Malicious JavaScript code hidden in a Tornado Cash governance proposal has been leaking deposit notes and data to a private server for almost two months.

The FBI says in a joint advisory issued with the NSA, the U.S. Cyber Command, and international partners, that Russian threat actors from APT28 are using compromised Ubiquiti EdgeRouters to build extensive botnets that help them steal credentials, collect NTLMv2 digests, and proxy malicious traffic.

Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that the Black Basta and Bl00dy ransomware gangs have joined widespread attacks targeting ScreenConnect servers unpatched against CVE-2024-1708 and CVE-2024-1709, two maximum severity authentication bypass vulnerabilities.
The FBI, CISA, and the Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) warn U.S. healthcare organizations of targeted ALPHV/Blackcat ransomware attacks.
Pharmaceutical giant Cencora says they suffered a cyberattack where threat actors stole data from corporate IT systems.

Researchers from JFrog discover at least 100 instances of malicious AI ML models on the Hugging Face platform, some of which can execute code on the victim's machine, giving attackers a persistent backdoor.
A security researcher named HaxRob discovers a previously unknown Linux backdoor named GTPDOOR, designed for covert operations within mobile carrier networks.
Researchers from Cisco Talos uncover a campaign targeting Mexican users with tax-themed phishing lures to distribute a previously undocumented Windows malware called TimbreStealer.

Researchers from Mandiant expose a campaign carried out by an Iran-nexus threat actor known as UNC1549  targeting aerospace, aviation, and defense industries in the Middle East, including Israel and the U.A.E through two backdoors dubbed MiniBike and MiniBus.

Researchers from Zscaler observe a previously undocumented threat actor dubbed SPIKEDWINE targeting officials in European countries with Indian diplomatic missions using a new backdoor called WINELOADER.

Hochschule Kempten, a university of applied sciences in the city of Kempten in Germany, announces being targeted by a criminal cyberattack that forced the institution to take down its IT infrastructure.
Ireland’s Department of Foreign Affairs (DFA) investigates a possible breach after an extortion group named Mogilevich claims to have stolen 7GB of compromised documents for sale.
The Mogilevich group also lists three undisclosed companies on their site.

Ukraine's military intelligence unit warns that Russia has poured more than $1 billion into “Maidan-3”, an ongoing disinformation campaign aimed to diminish Western support for Kyiv and sow panic and distrust among Ukrainian citizens.

Researchers from Mandiant reveal that a Chinese threat actor tracked as UNC5325 has been observed exploiting the Ivanti CVE-2024-21893 to deploy new malware families such as LittleLamb.WoolTea, PitStop, Pitdog, PitJet, and PitHook.
European discount retailer Pepco Group reveals that its Hungarian business has lost a significant amount of money (€15.5 Million) to cybercriminals.
The Akira ransomware group threatens to leak nearly 200GB of stolen data from Bjuv Municipality’s systems.
Researchers from Bitdefender discover a new variant of the AMOS (Atomic) Stealer, leveraging a Python script to stay covert.
Researchers from Infoblox reveal that a threat actor named Savvy Seahorse is abusing CNAME DNS records Domain Name System to create a traffic distribution system that powers financial scam campaigns.
Japan's Computer Security Incident Response Team (JPCERT/CC) warns that the notorious North Korean hacking group Lazarus has uploaded four malicious PyPI packages to infect developers with malware.

Researchers from Avast reveal that North Korean threat actors known as the Lazarus Group exploited CVE-2024-21338, a flaw in the Windows AppLocker driver (appid.sys) as a zero-day to gain kernel-level access and turn off security tools, allowing them to bypass noisy BYOVD (Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver) techniques.
The LockBit ransomware gang is once again conducting attacks, using updated encryptors with ransom notes linking to new servers after last week's law enforcement disruption.
According to a wave of online reports from Anycubic customers, someone hacked their 3D printers to warn that the devices are exposed to attacks.
Houser LLP, a U.S. law firm that specializes in serving high-profile financial institutions, says a system breach discovered in May 2023 exposed the personal data of more than 325,000 people.

Researchers from CloudSEK reveal that Cybercriminals are using a massive network of hired mules in India and xHelper, an Android-based money transfer application to launder illicit proceeds, researchers have found.
Anycubic customers report that their 3D printers were hacked, displaying a message warning of an alleged security flaw in the company’s systems.

Threat actors are targeting people in the cryptocurrency space in attacks that start with a link added to the target’s calendar at Calendly, a popular application for scheduling appointments and meetings.
Researchers from Apiiro discover an ongoing attack flooding more than 100,000 GitHub repositories with obfuscated malware that steals passwords and cryptocurrency from developer devices.

Researchers from Dragos reveal that "Voltzite," the operational technology (OT)-focused unit within China's Volt Typhoon APT, is targeting electric transmission and distribution organizations in African nations
AI service Cutout.Pro suffers a data breach exposing the personal information of 20 million members, including email addresses, hashed and salted passwords, IP addresses, and names.

Researchers from Lookout discover CryptoChameleon, an advanced phishing kit exhibiting novel tactics to target cryptocurrency platforms as well as the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) via mobile devices.

Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a new Linux variant of the Bifrost (a.k.a. Bifrose) remote access trojan (RAT) employing several novel evasion techniques, including the use of a deceptive domain that was made to appear as part of VMware.
The Golden Corral American restaurant chain discloses a data breach after attackers behind an August cyberattack stole the personal information of over 180,000 people.
The U.S. CISA adds CVE-2023-29360, a high-severity vulnerability in the Microsoft Streaming Service (MSKSSRV.SYS) actively exploited in attacks, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog.

The Five Eyes (FVEY) intelligence alliance issues a new cybersecurity advisory warning of cyber threat actors exploiting known security flaws in Ivanti Connect Secure and Ivanti Policy Secure gateways, noting that the Integrity Checker Tool (ICT) can be deceived to provide a false sense of security.
The U.S. cybersecurity and intelligence agencies CISA, FBI, and MS-ISAC warn of Phobos ransomware attacks targeting government and critical infrastructure entities.

The Taiwan ministry of national defense says that threat actors stole “sensitive information” including military and government documents from Chunghwa Telecom, Taiwan’s largest telecom company and sold it on the dark web.
Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a campaign where scammers on Airbnb are faking technical issues and citing higher fees to get users to a spoofed Tripadvisor website and steal their money.
The Chelan County Public Utility District is impacted by a “cybersecurity event" that kept a nationwide vendor from mailing and emailing statements.
Threat actors steal $6 million from the Seneca stablecoin protocol across the Ethereum and Arbitrum networks by exploiting a bug in the protocol's smart contract approval mechanisms
Researchers from Recorded Future identify a new infrastructure likely used by the operators of the commercial spyware known as Predator in at least 11 countries.
Researchers from Sucuri identified a fresh wave of SocGholish (fake browser update) infections targeting WordPress websites.

Researchers from Malwarebytes unveil a campaign where cyber criminals are targeting Mac users interested in cryptocurrency opportunities with fake calendar invites. During the attacks the criminals will send a link supposedly to add a meeting to the target’s calendar. In reality the link runs a script to install Mac malware on the target’s machine.
Muscatine Power and Water warns the public of a ransomware attack discovered on January 26.
Mr Green Gaming, a game community, suffers a breach when an inactive admin account is exploited, resulting in the leak of personal details belonging to 27,000 members.
Researchers from Trend Micro discover a campaign from the RA World ransomware group, targeting several healthcare organizations in the Latin American region.
American Express warns customers that credit cards were exposed in a third-party data breach after a merchant processor was hacked.
Researchers from Proofpoint identify the threat actor TA577 using a new attack chain to demonstrate an uncommonly observed objective: stealing NT LAN Manager (NTLM) authentication information.

Researchers from Proofpoint identify a second campaign by the threat actor TA577 using a new attack chain to demonstrate an uncommonly observed objective: stealing NT LAN Manager (NTLM) authentication information.

Researchers from Kroll reveal that the North Korean APT hacking group Kimsuky is exploiting ScreenConnect flaws, particularly CVE-2024-1708 and CVE-2024-1709, to infect targets with a new malware variant dubbed ToddlerShark.

The South Korean National Intelligence Service (NIS) reveal that North Korean hackers breached at least two South Korean microchip equipment companies in recent months, stealing product design drawings and facility site photos.
The Main Intelligence Directorate (GUR) of Ukraine's Ministry of Defense claims that it breached the servers of the Russian Ministry of Defense (Minoborony) and stole sensitive documents.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a Trojan, dubbed CHAVECLOAK, targeting Brazilian banking users via malicious PDFs.
Fidelity Investments Life Insurance informs roughly 28,000 individuals that their personal information was compromised in a data breach at third-party services provider Infosys McCamish System (IMS).
South St. Paul Public Schools alerts families to an ongoing technology disruption that is being investigated.
Russia publishes an intercepted conversation via Webex, in which Bundeswehr officials discuss the country’s support for Ukraine, particularly around the supply of Taurus cruise missiles.
Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal that two ransomware groups, GhostSec and Stormous, have joined forces in attack campaigns with double-extortion attacks using the new GhostLocker 2.0 ransomware.

Canada’s financial intelligence agency FINTRAC (Financial Transactions and Reports Analysis Centre of Canada) announces pulling its corporate systems offline due to a cyber incident that struck over the weekend.
Researchers from Zscaler discover a threat actor creating fraudulent Skype, Google Meet, and Zoom websites to spread the SpyNote RAT to Android users and NjRAT and DCRat to Windows users.

Researchers from AhnLab discover a new malware dubbed 'WogRAT' targeting both Windows and Linux in attacks abusing an online notepad platform named 'aNotepad' as a covert channel for storing and retrieving malicious code.
Apple releases emergency security updates to address two iOS zero-day vulnerabilities, respectively tracked as CVE-2024-23225 and CVE-2024-23296, exploited in attacks against iPhone devices.
Researchers from Kaspersky detect Malicious actors abusing the open-source hypervisor platform QEMU as a tunneling tool in a cyberattack against a large company.
Researchers from Sucuri discover a new variant of the Angel Drainer campaign resulting in distributed brute force attacks against target WordPress websites.
Security researchers uncover multiple cases of JetBrains TeamCity exploitation (CVE-2024-27198, CVE-2024-27199) being followed up by deployments of (suspected modified) Jasmin Ransomware.
Researchers from CYFIRMA discover a destructive malware of Russian origin dubbed WinDestroyer.
Researchers from Sygnia reveal the details of a ransomware attack carried out from the BlackCat/ALPHV ransomware operation.
Decentralized finance platform WOOFi experiences an $8.75 million exploit when an unidentified hacker used flash loans to manipulate the algorithm.

Researchers from Proofpoint observe an increase in credential phishing and fraud campaigns from TA4903, spoofing various small and medium-sized businesses (SMBs) across various industries including construction, manufacturing, energy, finance, food and beverage,
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the CVE-2021-36380 Sunhillo SureLine OS Command Injection Vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
"The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the CVE-2023-21237 Android Pixel Information Disclosure Vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
Pet retail giant PetSmart warns some customers their passwords were reset due to an ongoing credential stuffing attack attempting to breach accounts.
Threat actors start to exploit the critical-severity authentication bypass vulnerability (CVE-2024-27198) in TeamCity On-Premises.
The city of Hamilton is still recovering from a ransomware attack that has affected nearly every facet of government functions.
The Stormous ransomware gang takes credit for an attack on Duvel Moortgat Brewery, a major Belgian beer producer.

Researchers from Trend Micro reveal that the Russian-speaking cybercrime group called RedCurl is leveraging a legitimate Microsoft Windows component called the Program Compatibility Assistant (PCA) to execute malicious commands.
Nations Direct Mortgage say more than 83,000 customers were affected by a late 2023  data breach that leaked Social Security numbers and other sensitive information.
Researchers from Group-IB discover a previously undocumented threat actor called Lotus Bane targeting financial entities in Vietnam.
As Russia prepares for its presidential election, its systems are reportedly being targeted by “massive” cyberattacks, according to local authorities.
Sensitive data on businesses and individuals in South Africa is at risk after a cyberattack on the Companies and Intellectual Property Commission (CIPC) agency.
Researchers from Cado Security discover a new campaign named "Spinning YARN" using a new Linux malware campaign targeting misconfigured Apache Hadoop, Confluence, Docker, and Redis instances.
Researchers from Cybereason warn that threat actors are utilizing Facebook messages to spread the Snake malware, a Python-based information stealer.
Researchers from Sucuri discover an uptick in attacks from a new malware campaign targeting this same Popup Builder vulnerability.
Researchers from PIXM reveal that public schools across the United States are facing a surge in sophisticated phishing campaigns linked to two threat groups: Tycoon and Storm-1575.
Researchers from Inquest reveal the details of Planet stealer, a malware utilized in recent campaigns.

Financial services firm Paysign says it is investigating reports of a data breach involving consumer information after a threat actor tried to sell a database allegedly belonging to the company containing 1,242,575 records of records.
The Leicester City Council is hit with a cyber attack.
Researchers from OP Innovate reveal that an Iranian state-backed hacking group recently infiltrated Rashim Software, and used that access to intimidate other Israeli organizations.
Researchers from Cofense discover a two-month campaign that used SVG files to deliver the Agent Tesla Keylogger and the XWorm RAT malware.

Researchers from ESET discover a cyberespionage campaign that leverages the Monlam Festival – a religious gathering – to target Tibetans in several countries and territories via watering hole and supply chain attacks.

The Hong Kong Securities and Futures Commission blocks fake websites posing as major local cryptocurrency exchanges, impersonating two licensed exchanges in Hong Kong: OSL Digital Securities and Hash Blockchain Limited, also known as HashKey.
Researchers from Darktrace discover a novel phishing campaign leveraging legitimate Dropbox infrastructure and successfully bypassing multifactor authentication (MFA) protocols

Researchers from Check Point discover a financially motivated group named Magnet Goblin, using various 1-day vulnerabilities to breach public-facing servers and deploy custom malware on Windows and Linux systems.
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) discloses that threat actors breached their systems in February through vulnerabilities in Ivanti products
Researchers from Guidepoint discover that the BianLian ransomware group, is gaining initial access to the target by exploiting flaws in a TeamCity server.
Roku says it canceled unauthorized subscriptions and refunded more than 15,000 accounts after discovering what they called “suspicious activity.”
