A new ransomware strain dubbed 'DoNex' is observed in the wild targeting organizations in multiple countries.

Microsoft reveals that APT29 (a.k.a. Cozy Bear, Midnight Blizzard, Nobelium, The Dukes) used the information initially exfiltrated from their corporate email systems to access portions of the source code.

Microsoft reveals that APT29 (a.k.a. Cozy Bear, Midnight Blizzard, Nobelium, The Dukes) is using information initially exfiltrated from their corporate email systems to gain, or attempt to gain, unauthorized access.
A report published by Lithuanian security services warne that China has escalated its espionage operations against Lithuania.

The threat actor known as IntelBroker claims responsibility for a data breach targeting Acuity, a Federal contractor. The breach resulted in the theft of sensitive data and documents from two prominent U.S. government entities: U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) and U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS). One month later Acuity confirms the breach.
column3: Vulnerability in an Acuity Tekton CI/CD server

column2: The developers of the Leather cryptocurrency wallet warn of a fake app on the Apple App Store, with users reporting it is a wallet drainer that stole their digital assets.
Koffie Beyers, a Belgian coffee roaster, is hit with a cyber attack.
A number of French government agencies are hit by “intense” cyberattacks
Researchers from Sysdig discover a malicious campaign using the blockchain-based Meson service to create 6,000 Meson Network nodes using a compromised cloud account.
The Russian independent media organization Meduza says that it has been targeted by an “unprecedented” cyber campaign ahead of the upcoming presidential election.
Researchers from IBM discover a targeted campaign by the Russian threat actor Fancy Bear.
Researchers from Dr.Web reveal the details of a targeted attack against an undisclosed Russian mechanical-engineering organization.
La Mesa temporarily suspends public comments via Zoom following a rash of antisemitic hate speech during last month's City Council meeting.
Researchers from ReversingLabs discover BIPClip, a campaign using PyPI packages posing as open-source libraries to steal BIP39 mnemonic phrases, which are used for wallet recovery.
As the tax deadline approaches, the U.S. Internal Revenue Service (IRS) warns taxpayers about impersonation scams.

Researchers from Scam Sniffer reveal that impersonated accounts on X (formerly Twitter) are blamed for the majority of cryptocurrency phishing attacks during February 2024, with victims losing almost $47M.
The LockBit ransomware gang says it was behind an attack on South Africa’s government workers pension fund last month, which has hampered the organization’s operations and disrupted pension payments.

Acer Philippines confirms that employee data was stolen in an attack on a third-party vendor who manages the company's employee attendance data after a threat actor with the moniker of 'ph1ns' leaked the data on a hacking forum.
Researchers from Threatdown discover a campaign delivering the FakeBat malware via several active malvertising campaigns.
Researchers from Zscaler discover a new campaign distributing an infostealer called Tweaks (aka Tweaker) that targets Roblox users.
Researchers from Fortinet uncover a phishing campaign enticing users to download a malicious Java downloader with the intention of spreading new VCURMS and STRRAT remote access trojans.
A cyberattack dirsrupts operations at MarineMax, one of the world’s biggest boat sellers. The Rhysida ransomware group claims responsibility for the attack.
Researchers from Trend Micro discover a DarkGate campaign where DarkGate operators exploited the Microsoft Windows SmartScreen bypass CVE-2024-21412 Vulnerability.
Researchers from IBM discover a new version of the PixPirate banking trojan for Android employing a new method to hide on phones while remaining active, even if its dropper app has been removed.
France Travail, formerly known as Pôle Emploi, warns that threat actors breached its systems and may leak or exploit personal details of an estimated 43 million individuals.

Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal that threat actors are leveraging digital document publishing (DDP) sites hosted on platforms like FlipSnack, Issuu, Marq, Publuu, RelayTo, and Simplebooklet for carrying out phishing, credential harvesting, and session token theft.
The hacktivist group Anonymous Sudan claims credit for a cyberattack that disrupts Alabama state government.
Researchers from G-Data discover 'gitgub', a campaign exploiting at least 13 Github repositories hosting cracked software designed to deliver the RisePro info-stealer.
Documentation startup Mintlify says dozens of customers had GitHub tokens exposed in a data breach at the start of the month.

Researchers from Kaspersky discover a malvertising campaign targeting Chinese users looking for legitimate software such as Notepad++ and VNote on search engines like Baidu to distribute trojanized versions of the software and ultimately deploy Geacon, a Golang-based implementation of Cobalt Strike.
Researchers from Resecurity discover TMChecker, a new toolset on the dark web, gaining traction as an attack weapon to target remote access services and popular e-commerce platforms.
Researchers from F.A.C.C.T. reveal that SIM swappers have adapted their attacks to steal a target's phone number by porting it into a new eSIM card.
An RAF plane carrying U.K. Defence Secretary Grant Shapps has its GPS signal jammed while flying close to Russian territory.
The New Mexico Administrative Office of the District Attorneys is hit with a ransomware attack.
NHS Dumfries and Galloway, part of the Scottish healthcare system, announces it was the target “of a focused and ongoing cyber attack.” The INC ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
Encina Wastewater Authority (EWA) is hit by the BlackByte ransomware group.
The Scranton School District is hit with a ransomware attack.
The International Monetary Fund (IMF) discloses that a cyberattack in February led to the compromise of 11 email accounts.
Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a new version of the BunnyLoader malware, characterized by new evasion techniques.
Researchers from Cyble observe the ransomware actor 'ShadowSyndicate' scanning for servers vulnerable to CVE-2024-23334, a directory traversal vulnerability in the aiohttp Python library.

Researchers from Netskope discover an evasive Azorult campaign in the wild, employing multiple defense evasion techniques from delivery through execution to fly under the defender’s radar as it steals sensitive data.
Japanese tech giant Fujitsu discloses that several of its systems were infected by malware and warns that the hackers stole customer data.

The city of Birmingham, Alabama, experiences outages limiting government services more than a week after a network “disruption” forced officials to switch to cash transactions and to take other temporary actions.
Researchers from Brocom/Symantec discover a malware-as-a-service (MaaS) campaign targeting Android users based in India.

Pro-Palestinian threat actors calling themselves “Handala Hack” claim to have accessed 740GB of data from the messaging app Viber, including source code – Viber denies the breach but is investigating – Users are advised to change passwords.

Two threat actors (ShinyHunters and MajorNelson) put on sale 71 million records allegedly stolen from AT&T in 2021. However the company claims the data did not originate from its systems. Approximately one month later AT&T confirms the breach adding that the real number of impacted users is 51 million.
Roskomnadzor, the Russian watchdog agency records a “significant number” of DDoS attacks on the Russian systems involved in the presidential elections.

MediaWorks, a company based in New Zealand, says it is investigating an alleged security incident after a hacker claimed to have stolen the data of just over 2.4 million people and began targeting individuals for extortion payments.

Researchers from Trend Micro discover sophisticated campaign attributed to a Chinese Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group known as 'Earth Krahang' breaching 70 organizations and targeted at least 116 across 45 countries, exploiting CVE-2023-32315 and CVE-2022-21587 to gain initial access.

Electronic Arts has postpones the North American finals of the Apex Legends Global Series (ALGS) after a threat actor with the moniker 'Destroyer2009' compromised players mid-match during the tournament.

Researchers from Perception Point discover PhantomBlu, a malicious email campaign targeting hundreds of Microsoft Office users in US-based organizations to deliver NetSupport RAT, a remote access trojan that evades detection, partially by showing up as legitimate software.

Researchers from Sentinel One discover AcidPour, a new variant of the data wiping malware called AcidRain, targeting Viasat immediately before the Russian invasion of Ukraine, specifically designed for targeting Linux x86 devices.
The city government of Pensacola, Florida, is dealing with widespread phone outages due to a cyberattack announced over the weekend.
Threat actors hijack the official contact email for the Belgian SPA Grand Prix event and use it to lure fans to a fake website promising a €50 gift voucher.
The South China Athletic Association (SCAA) is investigating a leak of members’ personal data after an alleged hack that affected around 70,000 data subjects.
Henry County is hit with a Medusa ransomware attack
The U.S. Federal Trade Commission (FTC) warns that scammers are impersonating its employees to steal thousands of dollars from Americans.

Crinetics Pharmaceuticals, a Nasdaq-listed pharmaceutical development company, says it is investigating a cybersecurity incident following claims from the LockBit ransomware gang that data was stolen.
Researchers at Trend Micro discover threat actors deploying the Jasmin ransomware exploiting the TeamCity JetBrains CVE-2024-1798 and CVE-2024-1799 vulnerabilities.
Researchers at Trend Micro discover threat actors deploying a variant of the open-source XMRig cryptocurrency-mining malware to vulnerable TeamCity servers.
Researchers at Trend Micro discover threat actors deploying the SparkRAT backdoor to vulnerable TeamCity servers.
Researchers at Trend Micro discover threat actors deploying Cobalt Strike beacons to vulnerable TeamCity servers.
The Pokémon Company says it detected hacking attempts against some of its users and reset those user account passwords.
Researchers from Securonix discover DEEP#GOSU, an elaborate multi-stage attack campaign likely associated with the North Korean Kimsuky group.

Researchers from Ukraine’s major state cyber agency (SSSCIP) and Palo Alto Networks identify 23 Smokeloader campaigns from a Russian threat actor, aimed at various targets in Ukraine, including financial institutions and government organizations.
Researchers from Bi.Zone discover a campaign targeting at least 140 organizations in Russia with multiple malware payloads including Meta Stealer.
Radiant Logistics, an international freight technology company, says it has cut off a portion of its business in Canada after a cyberattack.
The Russian threat actors from UAC-0165 disrupts the network of Misto-TV, a local ISP in Ukraine and claims to have obtained the client database and internal documentation.
Trezor's X (formerly Twitter) account is hijacked by cryptocurrency scammers via a bogus Calendly invite.
The Long Island Plastic Surgical Group (LIPSG) suffers a ransomware attack from the ALPHV/BlackCat and Radar groups

Researchers from SlashNext discover a new attack called "Conversation Overflow" where threat actors use cloaked emails to deceive machine learning detectors, enabling the infiltration of malicious content into enterprise networks.
Researchers from BlueVoyant discover 'Naur Legal', a campaign targeting a diverse array of organizations by exploiting the inherent trust associated with legal services.

An Iran-linked group claims to have breached the computer network of the Shimon Peres Negev Nuclear Research Center and to have stolen and published thousands of documents — including PDFs, emails, and PowerPoint slides.
Researchers from ESET record a considerable increase in AceCryptor attacks, with detections tripling between the first and second halves of 2023.
Researchers from Microsoft warn of new and sophisticated tax phishing scams targeting taxpayers, impersonating trusted sources and use urgency tactics to steal personal and financial data.

Researchers from Malwarebytes discover a campaign where threat actors are attempting to compromise Social Security numbers with a tax phishing attack targeting small business owners and self-employed filers offering a link to apply for the necessary federal employee identification number (EIN).
Researchers from Imperva discover a new version of the Sysrv botnet exploiting Google sites to deliver the XMRig Miner.
column3: Multiple vulnerabilities including CVE-2017-9805, CVE-2023-22527, CVE-2021-26084

column2: The City of Jacksonville Beach is hit with a LockBit ransomware attack.
Police in Romania and Spain takes down a sophisticated cyber-fraud gang that tricked victims out of millions of dollars through fake ads and business email compromise (BEC) scams.
The American Renal Associates (now known as Innovative Renal Care) is hit with a Medusa ransomware attack.
Researchers from Sucuri discover a previously unknown malware campaign called Sign1, infecting over 39,000 websites over the past six months, causing visitors to see unwanted redirects and popup ads.

Researchers from Secureworks warn of a campaign using fake obituaries, created via AI, and designed to make money for their creators by redirecting visitors to adult entertainment sites and initiating antivirus (AV) popups.

Researchers from Mandiant discover two groups allegedly connected to the People's Republic of China exploiting two popular vulnerabilities on ScreenConnect and F5 to attack U.S. defense contractors, U.K. government entities and institutions in Asia.
Researchers from Proofpoint discover a new campaign carried out by the Iranian threat actor TA450 targeting organizations in Israel.

Security researchers release a proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for CVE-2023-48788, a critical vulnerability in Fortinet's FortiClient Enterprise Management Server (EMS) software, which is now actively exploited in attacks. Few days later CISA adds the vulnerability to its KEV (Known Exploited Vulnerability) Catalog.
Researchers from Rapid7 discover a new campaign launched by the Korean threat actor Kimsuky.
The Russian threat actors from UAC-0165 disrupts the network of KIM, a local ISP in Ukraine and claims to have obtained the client database and internal documentation.
The Tarrant County Appraisal District suffers a ransomware attack. Approximately two weeks later the Medusa ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack,
Researchers from AhnLab discover a StealC and Vidar malware campaign masquerading as an installer and distributed widely through platforms like Discord, GitHub, and Dropbox.

Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal that the Russia-linked threat actor known as Turla infected several systems belonging to an unnamed European non-governmental organization (NGO) in order to deploy a backdoor called TinyTurla-NG (TTNG).

Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a new large-scale StrelaStealer malware campaign, impacting over a hundred organizations across the United States and Europe, attempting to steal email account credentials.
Monmouth College discloses a ransomware attack.

Researchers from Mandiant discover a campaign since late February, where threat actors from APT29 used a new backdoor variant publicly tracked as WINELOADER to target German political parties with a CDU-themed lure.
The Russian threat actors from UAC-0165 disrupts the network of Triacom, a local ISP in Ukraine and claims to have obtained the client database and internal documentation.
The Russian threat actors from UAC-0165 disrupts the network of Linktelecom, a local ISP in Ukraine and claims to have obtained the client database and internal documentation.
Researchers from Resecurity observe a significant increase in fraudulent activities and scams during the month of Ramadan, coinciding with a surge in retail and online transactions.

Customers of bankrupt crypto platform BlockFi are targeted with a very convincing phishing email impersonating the platform, asking them to connect their wallet to complete the withdrawal of remaining funds.
Emergency Medical Services Authority (EMSA) says, it identified suspicious activity in its IT network and is mailing letters to patients whose information may have been involved.
Real-world asset liquidity provider Curio suffers a smart contract exploit resulting in a $16 million loss.
Researchers from Threatdown discover a malvertising campaign delivering the Rhadamanthys stealer via a new malware named Go loader.

Researchers from Checkmarx discover a campaign infecting multiple python developers, including a maintainer of Top.gg, with information-stealing malware after downloading a malicious clone of Colorama, a highly popular tool.

A new SEO Poisoning campaign exploits Google's new AI-powered 'Search Generative Experience' algorithms to recommend scam sites that redirect visitors to unwanted Chrome extensions, fake iPhone giveaways, browser spam subscriptions, and tech support scams.

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the CVE-2021-44529 Ivanti Endpoint Manager Cloud Service Appliance (EPM CSA) Vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the CVE-2019-7256 Nice Linear eMerge E3-Series OS Command Injection Vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
The city of St. Cloud says it discovered a ransomware attack affecting city services.
Researchers from Sekoia discover Tycoon 2FA Phishing-as-a-Service (PhaaS), a new Adversary-in-The-Middle (AiTM) phishing kit allegedly used by multiple threat actors to carry out widespread attacks.

The Communications Workers Union (CWU), which represents hundreds of thousands of employees in sectors across the UK economy including tech and telecoms, is currently working to mitigate a cyberattack.
The State Department’s oversight office warns current and former employees to be cautious of a fraudulent scheme targeting workers’ payroll accounts.
A threat actor claims responsibility for a data breach to Giant Tiger and leaks 2.8 million customer records on a forum.
Researchers from Kaspersky issue a cautionary alert regarding the proliferation of fake online deals for the popular weight-loss drug Ozempic.

Decentralized finance aggregator ParaSwap rectifies a critical vulnerability in its smart contract, after the exploitation of the vulnerability resulted in minimal losses of $24,000 before white hat hackers intervened.
The Securities and Futures Commission of Hong Kong warns against entities operating under the name "HKCEXP" and "EDY" saying the names falsely poses as an SFC-registered entities.
The government of New Zealand reveals that the Parliamentary Counsel Office and the Parliamentary Service in 2021, suffered a cyber attack from the PRC state-sponsored group known as APT40.
Researchers at Trend Micro discover a new Rust variant of the Agenda ransomware, propagating to vCenters and ESXi via a custom PowerShell script.
Researchers at Trustwave discover new phishing campaign leveraging a novel loader malware to deliver the Agent Tesla information stealer and keylogger.

Researchers at ReversingLabs identify "SqzrFramework480", a .NET dynamic link library (DLL) allegedly pertaining to Bozhon Precision Industry Technology, that may be hiding industrial espionage malware.

The Big Issue, a street newspaper in the United Kingdom famed for providing homeless people with a legitimate income by paying them as vendors to distribute the magazine, confirms being impacted by a cyber incident, following the company being listed on the Qilin ransomware gang’s darknet extortion site.

Researchers at Oligo discover a new campaign dubbed "ShadowRay", targeting CVE-2023-48022, an unpatched vulnerability in Ray, a popular open-source AI framework, to hijack computing power and leak sensitive data from thousands of companies.
Researchers at Black Lotus discover a new variant of "TheMoon" malware botnet infecting thousands of outdated small office and home office (SOHO) routers and IoT devices in 88 countries.

Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a campaign carried out by the Chinese threat actor Stately Taurus, targeting organizations involved in the ASEAN-Australia Special Summit via two specific malware strains.
Researchers from Palo Alto Networks discover a campaign carried out by an unspecified Chinese threat actor, targeting an ASEAN-affiliated entity.

Researchers from Morphisec reveal that the banking trojan known as Mispadu has expanded its focus beyond Latin America (LATAM) and Spanish-speaking individuals to target users in Italy, Poland, and Sweden.
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the CVE-2023-24955 Microsoft SharePoint Server Code Injection Vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
The government of Gilmer County in Georgia posts a notice on its website warning that a ransomware attack was affecting its ability to provide services to its more than 30,000 residents.
Several Apple customers report being targeted in elaborate phishing attacks via ‘MFA Bombing’, which involve what appears to be a bug in Apple’s password reset feature.
The Munchables blockchain-based game is attacked, with about $62 million worth of cryptocurrency was stolen from the game. Few hours after the attacker agrees to return the stolen funds.
Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign from the Kimsuky group distributing the Endoor backdoor disguised as an installer from a Korean public institution.
Researchers from Human discover PROXYLIB, a campaign carried out via several malicious Android apps turning mobile devices into residential proxies (RESIPs) for other threat actors.

Cisco warns customers of password-spraying attacks targeting Remote Access VPN services configured on Cisco Secure Firewall devices. THis technique could have been exploited by the Brutus botbet with overlaps with activity from AP29
VNDirect, one of Vietnam's largest brokerages, begins the process of restoring its systems after a cyberattack that forced it to suspend trading transactions.

Researchers from Netcraft reveal the details of 'Darcula', a Chinese-language Phishing-as-a-Service platform targeting organizations in 100+ countries with sophisticated techniques, such as Message and RCS smishing attacks, using more than 20,000 phishing domains.
Researchers from Check Point discover multiple instances of tax-related phishing scams targeting taxpayers, using QR code schemes, bogus refunds and AI imposters.
Researchers from Cyble discover a tax-themed campaign distributing the WarzoneRAT (Avemaria), resurfacing following the FBI's dismantling of its malware operation and seizure of infrastructure.

Researchers from EclecticIQ uncover Operation FlightNight, a new espionage campaign targeting Indian government agencies and the country’s energy industry with a modified version of an open-source information stealer called HackBrowserData that can collect browser login credentials, cookies and history.

An investigation reveals that personal information of more than 2.7 million Pakistanis has been “stolen” from the records of the National Database and Registration Authority (Nadra) office, a government-run body that regulates the database of citizens.
American retailer Hot Topic discloses that two waves of credential stuffing attacks in November exposed affected customers' personal information and partial payment data.
The Python Package Index (PyPI) temporarily suspends user registration and the creation of new projects to deal with an ongoing malware campaign.

A threat actor steals about $11.6 million from Prisma Finance, a popular decentralized finance (DeFi) platform. Shortly after the attacker declares to be a "white hat" and available to return the funds.
Researchers from Kaspersky discover a Linux version of the DinodasRAT (a.k.a. Xdealer)

Researchers from F.A.C.C.T. discover PhantomCore, a new cyber-espionage group with links to Ukraine that has been operating since at least January of this year with a remote access tool called PhantomRAT exploiting the CVE-2023-38831 WinRAR vulnerability.

Researchers from Mandiant reveal that Russian influence operations linked to the notorious leader of the Wagner Group mercenary troops, Yevgeniy Prigozhin, remain active months after his death, still trying to promote pro-Russia narratives in the U.S., including those about domestic politics and elections, the Russian invasion of Ukraine, and the Israel-Hamas conflict.
Red Hat warns that a malicious backdoor found in the widely used data compression software library xz may be present in instances of Fedora Linux 40 and the Fedora Rawhide developer distribution.
An infostealer malware campaign has collected more than 5 million of logins from users of various gaming websites, including players that use cheats, pay-to-cheat services.
Researchers from JAMF discover a campaign targeting Mac users searching for Arc Browser on search engines like Google to deliver the Atomic Stealer malware.
Researchers from JAMF discover a campaign targeting Mac users delvering a malware resembling the Rust-based Realst, in disguise of a fake Meethub application,

Atraf, a popular Israeli LGBTQ dating app, suffers a major data breach exposing personal information of over half a million users after a threat actor with the moniker "AK-47" dumps its database on Breach Forums.

Researchers from Fox-IT discover a new version of the Vultur banking trojan for Android that includes more advanced remote control capabilities and an improved evasion mechanism. The malware is delivered through a hybrid attack that relies on smishing and phone calls that trick the targets into installing a version of the malware that masquerades as the McAfee Security app.
The Traverse City Area Public Schools (TCAPS) remains close for a network disruption due to a possible cyber attack.
Data belonging to more than 1.3 million customers of the PandaBuy online shopping platform is leaked, allegedly after two threat actors exploited multiple vulnerabilities to breach systems.

Within hours of opposition leader Alexey Navalny’s death, a group of anti-Kremlin hackers deface the website of a prison contractor’s website, and also appear to have stolen a database containing information on hundreds of thousands of Russian prisoners and their relatives and contacts.
Chilean data center and hosting provider IxMetro Powerhost suffers a cyberattack at the hands of a new ransomware gang known as SEXi, which encrypts the company's VMware ESXi servers and backups.

Hoya Corporation, one of the largest global manufacturers of optical products, says a "system failure" caused servers at some of its production plants and business divisions to go offline. The Hunters International ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack and demands a $10M ransom.
Researchers from AhnLab discover a malicious campaign using a Google Ad statistical feature to embed URLs that distribute malware, including the Rhadamanthys stealer.
Researchers from Check Point uncovered a malware campaign distributing the Agent Tesla malware against American and Australian organizations.
Researchers from Trend Micro discover a threat activity cluster tracked as Earth Freybug using a new malware called UNAPIMON to fly under the radar.

Jackson County, Missouri, declares a state of emergency and closes key offices indefinitely as it responds to what officials believe is a ransomware attack that has made some of its IT systems inoperable.
Researchers from Sucuri discover a new variant of the Magento Shoplift malware targeting both WordPress and Magento CMS.
Researchers from McAfee discover a new Pikabot campaign leveraging various file types, including HTML, Javascript, and Excel, to breach security defenses.
Researchers at Intel471 discover a widespread phishing campaign carried out by a community of English-speaking threat actors dubbed 'The Com'.
Researchers from Perception Point discover a new phishing campaign by the threat actor TA558 targeting a wide range of sectors in Latin America with the goal of deploying Venom RAT.
Cancer treatment and research center City of Hope warns that a data breach exposed the sensitive information of over 820,000 patients.
The city of New York took its payroll website partially offline for the last nine days in response to a recent phishing scheme targeting city employees
Diabetes WA discloses a data breach affecting people who engaged with its telehealth service.
On Q Financial discloses a breach due to the ScreenConnect CVE-2024-1709 and CVE-2024-1708 vulnerabilities. The BianLian ransomware group claims responsibility for the attack.
The East Baton Rouge Sheriff's Office is hit with a ransomware attack. The Medusa group claims responsibility.

Researchers from Proofpoint discover a campaign where threat actors put links in YouTube video descriptions allegedly taking victims to other sites where information-stealing malware like Vidar, StealC and Lumma Stealer can be delivered.
Researchers from Cofense discover an updated version of an information-stealing malware Rhadamanthys, used in phishing campaigns targeting the oil and gas sector.
Researchers at Netenrich uncover a new ransomware group called Red Ransomware Group (Red CryptoApp).
At least a dozen Westminster insiders are targeted in a WhatsApp phishing attack.
Researchers from Cyble discover a fake e-shop campaign targeting 18 Malaysian banks with upgraded malicious applications and expanding to banks in Vietnam and Myanmar.
The U.S. Department of Health and Human Services (HHS) warns that threat actors are now using social engineering tactics to target IT help desks across the Healthcare and Public Health (HPH) sector.
Google fixes CVE-2024-29745 and CVE-2024-29748, two Google Pixel zero-days exploited by forensic firms to unlock phones without a PIN and gain access to the data stored within them.
SurveyLama suffers a data breach in February 2024, which exposes the sensitive data of 4.4 million users.
Omni Hotels & Resorts confirms that an alleged ransomware attack caused a nationwide IT outage that is still affecting its locations. The Daixin Team ransomware claims responsibility for the attack.
Researchers from Resecurity detect a new version of JSOutProx, targeting financial services and organizations in the APAC and MENA regions.
Ernest Health rehabilitation hospitals notify patients of a LockBit ransomware attack.
Otolaryngology Associates notifies 316,802 patients about a ransomware attack.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a campaign using a bogus installers for Adobe Acrobat Reader to distribute a new multi-functional malware dubbed Byakugan.
Researchers from Bitdefender reveal that cybercriminals are taking over Facebook pages and using them to advertise fake generative artificial intelligence software loaded with malware.
Visa warns about a spike in detections for a new version of the JsOutProx malware targeting financial institutions and their customers.
Researchers from Proofpoint and Team Cymru discover a new malware called Latrodectus, believed to be an evolution of the IcedID loader.

Researchers at Cisco Talos discover a cluster of activity tracked as CoralRaider, carried out by a threat actor of Vietnamese origin, and attacking India, China, South Korea, Bangladesh, Pakistan, Indonesia and domestic targets with the exfiltration malware  RotBot, a customized remote access tool, variant of the Quasar RAT.
Researchers from Perception Point discover a phishing attack using compromised LinkedIn accounts to steal the victims' credentials via the Snake malware.
Researchers from Sansec reveal that threat actors are exploiting CVE-2024-20720, a critical vulnerability in Magento to inject a persistent backdoor into ecommerce websites.
Two China-based Android app developers are sued by Google for an alleged scam targeting 100,000 users worldwide through fake cryptocurrency and other investment apps.

Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign targeting users of the popular text and code editor, Notepad++ carried out manipulating “mimeTools.dll,” a standard component of Notepad++ that provides encoding functionalities, such as Base64.
Researchers from Deep Instinct reveal that the Iranian threat actor known as MuddyWater has been attributed to a new command-and-control (C2) infrastructure called DarkBeatC2
Researchers from Google Mandiant reveal that several China-based hacking groups, including Volt Typhoon, are targeting a trio of vulnerabilities affecting Ivanti.

A group of hacktivists going by the name RGB-TEAM claims responsibility for hacking into the website of Russia’s prosecutor general, exposing data on criminal offenses committed in Russia over the past 30 years.
The government of Palau is hit with an alleged ransomware attack by the LockBit and DragonForce ransomware gangs.
Pacific Guardian Life Insurance says that 165,000 people had their financial info stolen in 2023 attack.

Researchers at Microsoft reveal that China-linked influence operations have begun to use generative artificial intelligence to amplify controversial domestic issues in places like the U.S. and Taiwan.
The NorthBay VacaValley Hospital in California is forced to turn some patients away due to a ransomware attack.
Threat actors break into the computer network of the Florida Department of Juvenile Justice.

The German Federal Office for Information Security, or BSI, and the Federal Office for the Protection of the Constitution warn that phishing attacks targeting political parties surged ahead of upcoming European Union elections.

In name of #OpEDSA, a Filipino hacktivist group operating under the pseudonym "ph1ns," breaks into servers owned and operated by the government's Department of Science and Technology and deletes up to 25 terabytes of confidential data and backups.
The Traverse City Area Public Schools are hit with a Medusa ransomware attack.
Researchers at Malwarebytes discover a campaign using a Bing advertisement designed to look like a link to install NordVPN leading to an installer for the remote access trojan SecTopRAT.
Researchers from Trustwave discover a new phishing campaign targeting organizations in the Latin American region to deliver malicious payloads to Windows systems.
Panera Bread suffers a ransomware attack.
Greylock McKinnon Associates reports a data breach, telling victims that personal information like Social Security numbers and more were accessed during an incident last May.

The University of Winnipeg in Canada confirms that threat actors stole sensitive information from the institution in an incident that took place late last month, affecting former and current students and staff.
A threat actor, with the moniker "ShopifyGUY," leaks personal information belonging to 7.5 million of customers of boAt, a consumer electronics company in India.

The Russian language fan club forum for the cybersecurity giant Kaspersky (forum.kasperskyclub.ru) experiences a data breach, during which a hacker group known as RGB leaks the personal data of 56,798 users online.

The RGB group, self-identifying as a hacktivist collective, also has asserts responsibility for breaching the Prosecutor’s Office of the Russian Federation (epp.genproc.gov.ru). To substantiate their claim, the group leaked an Excel file containing precisely 100,000 lines of information about criminal cases from 2013.

Researchers from Broadcom reveal that the Vedalia Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group, also known by its alias Konni, has been distributing malware using an innovative technique involving oversized LNK files.

Home Depot confirms that it suffered a data breach after one of its SaaS vendors mistakenly exposed a small sample of limited employee data, which could potentially be used in targeted phishing attacks.

Researchers from Fortinet observe a threat actor sending out a phishing email containing malicious Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) files, crafted to trick recipients into clicking on an attachment. The attachment downloads a ZIP file containing a Batch file obfuscated with the BatCloak tool. Then the attackers use ScrubCrypt to load the final payload VenomRAT.
Almost 2,000 hacked WordPress sites display fake NFT and discount pop-ups to trick visitors into connecting their wallets to crypto drainers that automatically steal funds.
UK veterinary services provider CVS Group announces that it suffered a cyberattack that disrupted IT services at its practices across the country.
Laptop and tablet accessories maker Targus discloses that it suffered a cyberattack disrupting operations after a threat actor gained access to the company's file servers.
Paris Saint-Germain (PSG), the Qatari-owned football team, informs its supporters that a cyberattack targeted the club’s online ticketing service

The Blackjack hackers, together with the SBU Cyber Department, destroy more than 300 TB of data from the Russian data center OwenCloud.ru, which was used by the Russian military-industrial complex, oil and gas, and telecom. The destruction of the Russian cloud service is allegedly made in retaliation for the attack on the Ukrainian data center Parkovy in January this year.
Researchers from F.A.C.C.T. discover Muliaka, a previously unknown ransomware gang attacking Russian businesses with malware based on the leaked source code from the Conti group.
Researchers from Sysdig discover a long-running botnet operated by a Romanian threat actor group, dubbed RUBYCARP, launching multiple attacks such as phishing and crypto miners.

Researchers from Cisco Talos discover "Starry Addax”, a threat actor targeting mostly human rights activists associated with the Sahrawi Arab Democratic Republic (SADR) cause with FlexStarling, a novel mobile malware.
Researchers from ThreatDown distributing the Nitrogen malware via fraudulent ads for popular system utilities like PuTTY and FileZilla.
Microsoft patches CVE-2024-29988, a SmartScreen Prompt Security Feature Bypass vulnerability exploited in the wild.
Microsoft patches CVE-2024-26234, a Proxy Driver Spoofing vulnerability exploited in the wild.

Researchers from Palo Alto Networks observe the threat actor known as Muddled Libra actively targeting software-as-a-service (SaaS) applications and cloud service provider (CSP) environments in a bid to exfiltrate sensitive data.

Researchers from Binary Defense reveal that attackers are now leveraging encrypted phishing emails that utilize Scalable Vector Graphics (SVG) files to execute malicious JavaScript code starting with an email masquerading as a notification for a new voice message.

Non-profit healthcare service provider Group Health Cooperative of South Central Wisconsin (GHC-SCW) discloses that a ransomware gang breached its network in January and stole documents containing the personal and medical information of over 500,000 individuals.
GBI Genios, a database company used by numerous media organizations in Germany, announces its servers are unavailable “due to a massive hacker attack.”
East Central University in Ada, Oklahoma, announces that it is investigating a BlackSuit ransomware attack that took place in February.
Researchers from HP discover new campaigns distributing Raspberry Robin via Windows Script Files (WSF).
Researchers from Checkmarx reveal that threat actors have been observed manipulating GitHub search results to infect developers with persistent malware.
Researchers from Proofpoint identify the threat actor TA547 targeting German organizations with an email campaign delivering the Rhadamanthys malware.
Apple sends threat notifications to iPhone users in 92 countries, warning them that they may have been targeted by mercenary spyware attacks.
Researchers from ESET discover eXotic Visit, an active espionage campaign targeting Android users with apps primarily posing as messaging services bundled with the open-source XploitSPY malware.
LastPass reveals that threat actors targeted one of its employees in a voice phishing attack, using deepfake audio to impersonate Karim Toubba, the company's Chief Executive Officer.
New Mexico Highlands University (NMHU) is forced to cancel all classes after suffering a ransomware attack.
Blackjack, a Ukrainian hacker group affiliated with the country’s security service claims to have targeted Moskollector, the firm that operates the communication system for Moscow’s sewage network.
CCM Health inform patients that protected health information (PHI) may have been accessed and exfiltrated during an attack that occurred between April 3 – April 10, 2023.

Researchers at Trend Micro observe a surge in cyberattacks targeting a number of organizations in various sectors such as technology, research, and government in the Asia-Pacific region, involving a malware family known as  Waterbear.
U.S. cybersecurity agency CISA warns Sisense customers to reset their credentials and secrets after the data analytics company reported a security incident.
Researchers from Sucuri discover a credit card skimmer concealed within a fake Meta Pixel tracker script in an attempt to evade detection.

The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the following D-Link multiple NAS devices flaws, CVE-2024-3272 and CVE-2024-3273, to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog.
Researchers from Phylum reveal that the popular Rust crate known as liblzma-sys has been compromised with the  XZ Utils backdoor.

Researchers from Recorded Future discover a large-scale Russian-language cybercrime operation using fake Web3 gaming initiatives to distribute malware, such as Atomic macOS Stealer (AMOS), Stealc, Rhadamanthys, or RisePro designed, to steal information from both macOS and Windows users.
Researchers from Cyble uncover a novel phishing campaign tailored to cryptocurrency users with the well-known FatalRAT along with additional malware such as Clipper and Keylogger.
Researchers from Blackberry discover a "renewed" cyber espionage campaign targeting users in South Asia with the aim of delivering an Apple iOS spyware variant of LightSpy, called "F_Warehouse".

Researchers from Forescout reveal the details of 'Connect:fun', an exploitation campaign targeting organizations running Fortinet’s FortiClient EMS, vulnerable to CVE-2023-48788 and deploying ScreenConnect and Powerfun as post-exploitation tools.
Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign installing the Metasploit Meterpreter backdoor via the Redis service.

Five municipalities near the river Loire on the west coast of France are hit by a LockBit ransomware attack on their shared computer servers, leaving staff without the ability to access documents or get on with their work.
The Federal Bureau of Investigation warns of a massive ongoing wave of SMS phishing attacks targeting Americans with lures regarding unpaid road toll fees.

Researchers from Claroty report that the Ukrainian Blackjack group claims to have damaged emergency detection and response capabilities in Moscow and beyond the Russian capital using a destructive ICS malware dubbed Fuxnet.
Roku warns that 576,000 accounts were hacked in new credential stuffing attacks after disclosing another incident that compromised 15,000 accounts in early March.
Dutch chipmaker Nexperia confirms that threat actors breached its network in March 2024 after the Dark Angels ransomware gang leaked samples of allegedly stolen data.
Conservative think tank The Heritage Foundation says that it experienced a cyberattack.
Insurance and banking conglomerate Suncorp is dealing with a cyberattack in which an intruder has accessed some customers’ bank balances and withdrawn funds.

Researchers from Palo Alto Networks reveal the details of Operation MidnightEclipse, the exploitation of the newly disclosed zero-day flaw in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software, CVE-2024-3400 Vulnerability, since March 26, 2024, nearly three weeks before it came to light yesterday.
An Iranian cyber group named Handala claims to have breached Israel's radar systems and sent hundreds of thousands of threatening text messages to Israeli citizens.
Researchers at the OpenJS Foundation stop a “credible” takeover attempt to compromise one of its popular JavaScript projects.
Researchers from Kaspersky reveal the details of an incident occurred using a customized version of the LockBit ransomware built with the leaked LockBit builder.

Researchers from Positive Technologies reveal the details of "SteganoAmor", a campaign launched by the threat actor TA558 concealing malicious code inside images using steganography to deliver various malware tools onto targeted systems.
Cisco Duo's security team warns that threat actors stole some customers' VoIP and SMS logs for multi-factor authentication (MFA) messages in a cyberattack on their telephony provider.

Ukrainian hackers from Cyber Resistance claim to have breached the Russian drone developer Albatross, leaking 100 gigabytes of data, including internal documentation, technical data and drawings of various types of unmanned aerial vehicles.
Researchers from Veriti discover a surge in attacks from operators of the Androxgh0st malware family, uncovering over 600 servers compromised primarily in the U.S., India and Taiwan.
Researchers from Proofpoint reveal the details of a campaign orchestrated by threat actors aligned with North Korea and targeting foreign policy experts for insight into US and the Republic of Korea.
Researchers from Fortinet observe multiple botnets exploiting CVE-2023-1389, a vulnerability targeting TP-Link Archer AX21 (AX1800) routers.
Czech transport minister Martin Kupka warn that Russia conducted ‘thousands’ of attempts to sabotage railways, attempting to interfere with train networks and signals.

Researchers from Cisco Talos warn about a global surge in brute-force attacks targeting various devices, including Virtual Private Network (VPN) services, web application authentication interfaces, and SSH services.

The Computer Emergency Team of Ukraine (CERT-UA) warns that threat actors from the group UAC-0184 are increasingly trying to plant data-stealing malware on messaging apps used by the Ukrainian armed forces.
Researchers from Broadcom discover L00KUPRU, a new variant of the Xorist ransomware, encrypting user files with the .L00KUPRU extension.

​The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) investigates a cyberattack after threat actors breached its IT systems to steal human resources data. The 8Base ransomware operation claims responsibility for the attack.
A threat actor allegedly hacks a database holding 5.7M Argentina’s driver’s licenses, requesting a payment of $3,000 USD for whoever wishes to purchase the images of Argentine licenses.
Poland’s national prosecutor Adam Bodnar declares that nearly 578 citizens were targeted with powerful commercial spyware Pegasus between 2017 and 2022.
The Atlantic States Marine Fisheries Commission (ASMFC) suffers an 8Base ransomware attack.
Cherry Health discloses a ransomware attack.

A cyber attack on the Bağcılar Training and Research Hospital in Istanbul compromises the confidential medical records, including X-ray scans and test results, taken at the hospital since 2007. It is rumored that the attackers asked for 200,000 dollars in exchange for the medical records.
Kisco Senior Living discloses a BlackByte ransomware attack.
“IntelBroker” claims to have breached Space-Eyes, a Miami-based geospatial intelligence firm.
Researchers from Cado Security reveal that threat actors are exploiting unpatched Atlassian servers to the  CVE-2023-22518 vulnerability to deploy a Linux variant of Cerber (aka C3RB3R) ransomware.
Researchers from WithSecure uncover Kapeka, a novel backdoor that has been used in attacks against victims in Eastern Europe since at least mid-2022.

Researchers from Microsoft warn that threat actors who appear to be Chinese are exploiting vulnerabilities in the OpenMetadata platform running as workloads on Kubernetes clusters to download cryptomining software onto the targeted systems.
Researchers from Zscaler observe a threat actor weaponizing a cluster of domains masquerading as legitimate IP scanner software sites to distribute "MadMxShell", a previously unseen backdoor.

Researchers from Blackberry reveal that the financially motivated threat actor FIN7 targeted a large U.S. car maker with spear-phishing emails for employees in the IT department to infect systems with the Anunak backdoor.
Researchers from Kaspersky discover SoumniBot, a new banking trojan targeting Korean users using obfuscation techniques targeting the Android operating system.
LastPass warns of a malicious campaign targeting its users with the CryptoChameleon phishing kit.
Researchers from Cisco Talos reveal that select Ukrainian government networks have been infected with a malware called OfflRouter since 2015.

Researchers from McAfee discover a new info-stealing malware linked to Redline posing as a game cheat called 'Cheat Lab,' promising downloaders a free copy if they convince their friends to install it too.

The Hospital Simone Veil in Cannes (CHC-SV) announces that it was targeted by a cyberattack, severely impacting its operations and forcing staff to go back to pen and paper. The LockBit ransomware operation claims responsibility for the attack.
Lebanon's state internet provider Ogero comes under a 10-day cyber attack of suspected Israeli origin.

Researchers from Microsoft reveal that Russia’s disinformation operations around the U.S. elections have ramped up over the last month-and-a-half after a relatively slow start compared to previous cycles.

CyberArmyofRussia_Reborn, a group with ties to the Russian government is suspected of carrying out a cyberattack in the Muleshoe water facility that caused a tank at a Texas water facility to overflow.
Threat actors try to unsuccessfully break into the town of Hale Center “firewall,” prompting the town to disable remote access to its SCADA system.
Town officials in Lockney detect “suspicious activity” on the town’s SCADA system.
Extern, a social justice charity, is hit with a ransomware attack.
The Post and Courier is hit with a BlackSuit ransomware attack.
The New York Bill Drafting Commission is taken down by a malware attack.
A legitimate-looking Google Search advertisement for the crypto trading platform 'Whales Market' redirects visitors to a wallet-draining phishing site that steals all the crypto assets.
Researchers from Kaspersky reveal the details of DuneQuixote, a previously undocumented campaign delivering a new backdoor dubbed CR4T.
Researchers from Perception Point discover a phishing campaign targeting users by exploiting an open redirect vulnerability from a domain belonging to coffee connoisseur, Nespresso.

Researchers from Avast uncover a new campaign by the North Korea-linked threat actor known as Lazarus Group employing fabricated job lures to deliver a new remote access trojan called Kaolin RAT, exploiting CVE-2024-21338, as part of attacks targeting specific individuals in the Asia region.
​American telecom provider Frontier Communications is hit by a cyberattack claimed by the RansomHub ransomware operation.

GhostR, a financially motivated criminal group says it has stolen a confidential database containing 5.3 million of records that companies use for screening potential customers for links to sanctions and financial crime from World-Check.

The LockBit ransomware operation claims to have stolen data from the D.C. Department of Insurance, Securities and Banking (DISB), however the agencies denies the claims, and states that the leaked data is from a third-party technology provider.
Blackstone Valley Community Health Care discloses a Hunters International ransomware attack.

The MITRE Corporation says that a state-backed threat actors breached its systems (MITRE's Networked Experimentation, Research, and Virtualization Environment - NERVE) in January 2024 by chaining the two Ivanti VPN zero-days CVE-2023-46805 and CVE-2024-21887.

CrushFTP warns customers in a private memo of CVE-2024-4040, an actively exploited zero-day vulnerability fixed in new versions released today, urging them to patch their servers immediately. Few days lated the U.S.  Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) adds the vulnerability to its catalog of exploited vulnerabilities.
Researchers from Fortinet discover a malicious PyPI package named discordpy_bypass-1.7.
The Ukraine Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT-UA) reveal that the Russian  group Sandworm aimed to disrupt operations at around 20 critical infrastructure facilities in Ukraine.
A new malware campaign is targeting individuals who actively seek out child pornography via a malicious executable called 'CryptVPN'.

Synlab Italia suspends all its medical diagnostic and testing services after a ransomware attack forced its IT systems to be taken offline. The BlackBasta ransomware gang claims responsibility for the attack.
The names and e-mail addresses of parents and teachers of 127 primary and secondary schools are leaked after Mobile Guardian, a mobile platform on students’ personal learning devices is hacked.
Valley Mountain Regional Center discloses a breach.
Token infrastructure platform Hedgey Finance undergoes two simultaneous exploits that resulted in a combined loss of $44.7 million
Threat actors associated with the Chinese government are believed to have hacked into Volkswagen systems in an effort to steal valuable data between 2011 and 2014.
The Union Hospital in Hong Kong is hit with an alleged LockBit ransomware attack.
Researchers from G Data discover "Sharp Stealer", an infostealer focused on the gamers' community.
Researchers from Kaspersky reveal that scammers have been observed employing a sophisticated tactic to steal Toncoins (TON) from Telegram users globally.

Researchers from Microsoft reveal that the notorious Russian APT28 group has been stealing credentials for years by exploiting the CVE-2022-38028 Windows Print Spooler bug and using a novel post-compromise tool known as “GooseEgg.”
Researchers from AhnLab discover a campaign distributing phishing files identical to Korean portal website login screens.
Researchers from Genians uncover a campaign by APT43 exploiting Dropbox to evade detection.

Belarusian politically motivated hacktivists from the Belarusian Cyber-Partisans group claim to have attacked the country’s largest state-run manufacturer of fertilizers, Grodno Azot, for its alleged involvement in political repression, sanctions evasion, and human rights violations.
Researchers from Kaspersky reveal the details of the latest campaign by the ToddyCat threat actors stealing “large volumes of data,” primarily from governmental targets in the Asia-Pacific region.
Medios de Prevención Externos Sur SL, a  medical company servicing Spain's Guardia Civil, is hit with a LockBit ransomware attack.

Almost 2,800 patients at Catholic Medical Center may have had their files containing personal and health information exposed in a third-party "data security incident" occurred to Lamont Hanley & Associates.

Researchers from Avast uncover a campaign where North Korean threat actors have been exploiting the updating mechanism of the eScan antivirus to plant backdoors on big corporate networks and deliver cryptocurrency miners through GuptiMiner malware.

Researchers from Cisco Talos discover a new ongoing malware campaign distributing three different stealers, such as CryptBot, LummaC2, and Rhadamanthys hosted on Content Delivery Network (CDN) cache domains.

The Korean National Police Agency (KNPA) reveal the details of a major campaign carried out by threat actors from North Korea, and targeting as many as 83 defense contractors and subcontractors, 10 of which had sensitive information stolen.

An unidentified threat actor hacks the website of Czech News Agency (CTK) a government-owned Czech news service, and publishes a fake story claiming that an assassination attempt had been made against the newly elected Slovak president, Petr Pellegrini.
Researchers from Malwarebytes uncover a malicious ad campaign targeting Facebook users via Google search.
The Russian independent news website Meduza faces repeated attempts to disrupt its digital infrastructure.

Researchers from SonicWall discover a malware campaign using a VBA macro in a Word document to download and execute a 64-bit Rust binary. This binary employs fileless injection techniques to load a malicious AgentTesla payload.

Skanlog, the Swedish logistics company that works with Sweden’s alcohol retail monopoly Systembolagethas, is hit with a ransomware attacks and prompts warnings from the country’s sole liquor retailer that its top shelves in stores around the country may be empty by the end of the week.
The Cyber Army of Russia claims responsibility for a cyber attack to the Tipton Wastewater Treatment Plant.
The anti-Donald Trump  super PAC Lincoln Project discloses to have lost $35,000 to a business email compromise (BEC) scam.

The threat group CiberInteligenciaSV releases what it says is sensitive information linked to El Salvador's state-operated bitcoin wallet Chivo, releasing source code on the criminal forum BreachForums.

​Cisco warns about ArcaneDoor, a campaign where a state-backed group tracked as UAT4356 has been exploiting two zero-day vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-20353 and CVE-2024-20359) in Adaptive Security Appliance (ASA) and Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) firewalls to breach government networks worldwide via two malware implants dubbed Line Dancer, and Line Runner.

Researchers from Zscaler discover a significant number of websites associated with fraudulent activities being hosted on popular web hosting and blogging platforms, distributing malware via SEO poisoning.

Researchers from WPScan reveal that threat actors are attempting to actively exploit CVE-2024-27956, a critical security flaw in the ValvePress Automatic plugin for WordPress that could allow site takeovers.
Researchers from Netcraft discover a campaign where threat actors are using compromised email accounts to send phishing emails containing links to PDF files hosted on Autodesk Drive.
Researchers from AhnLab discover an Infostealer strain made with Electron.
The plasma donation company Octapharma suffers a BlackSuit ransomware attack.

The Medusa ransomware group claims responsibility for a cyberattack on the servers of Northeast Ohio Neighborhood Health (NEON), a company providing healthcare services, and the exfiltration of nearly 51GB of data.
Researchers from Veriti discover a campaign targeting the education and government sectors in the U.S. through the Agent Tesla and Taskun malware.
Researchers from Securonix reveal the details of FROZEN#SHADOW, an ongoing campaign that's leveraging phishing emails to deliver the SSLoad malware.

Researchers from ThreatFabric discover a new Android banking trojan named Brokewell that can capture every event on the device, from touches and information displayed to text input and the applications the user launches.

Researchers from Deep Instinct reveal that an unknown threat actor targeted government entities in Ukraine toward the end of 2023 using an old Microsoft Office remote code execution (RCE) exploit from 2017 (CVE-2017-8570) as the initial vector and military vehicles as the lure.

The FBI publishes a warning about cyber criminals taking advantage of people’s fears about online dating by getting them to download fake “verification” sites that allow them to steal information and money.
Researchers from Akamai uncover a significant amount of highly likely malicious activity and domains purporting to be associated with the United States Postal Service (USPS).
The website of Belarus’ main security service agency (KGB) has reportedly been down for two months following a cyberattack by Belarusian politically motivated threat actors.
Researchers from Fortinet reveal the details of KageNoHitobito, a new ransomware strain targeting Windows users across various countries.

​The Los Angeles County Department of Health Services discloses a data breach after thousands of patients' personal and health information was exposed in a phishing attack impacting over two dozen employees.
Berry, Dunn, McNeil & Parker, a consulting firm with a medical data analytics business notifies more than 1 million individuals that threat actors stole their information from company servers.

Financial Business and Consumer Solutions (FBCS) warns initially 1,955,385 impacted individuals in the United States that the company suffered a data breach after discovering unauthorized access to specific systems in its network. One month later the company says over 3.2 million people have been impacted.
The California Statewide Automated Welfare System discloses that more than 19,000 online accounts may have been accessed by threat actors for nearly a year.
Designed Receivable Solutions (DRS), confirms the details of a data breach affecting 585,204 individuals.
Coffee County is hit with a cyber attack.

Researchers from Securonix uncover a new ongoing social engineering attack campaign, tracked as DEV#POPPER, likely associated with North Korean threat actors, targeting developers using fake interviews to deliver a Python-based RAT.
Researchers from Okta observe a spike in credential stuffing activity against user accounts of online services.

​Canadian pharmacy chain London Drugs closes all its retail stores to contain what it described as a "cybersecurity incident." One month later the LockBit ransomware operation claims responsibility for the attack.

Researchers from McAfee uncover a novel infection chain associated with DarkGate malware, commencing with an HTML-based entry point and progressing exploiting the AutoHotkey utility in its subsequent stages.

Researchers from Infoblox discover a new cluster of activity tracked as "Muddling Meerkat", believed to be linked to a Chinese state-sponsored threat actor's manipulation of DNS to probe networks globally.

Researchers from QAX discover a new Android backdoor malware named 'Wpeeper' in at least two unofficial app stores mimicking the Uptodown App Store, a popular third-party app store for Android devices with over 220 million downloads. The malware uses compromised WordPress sites to act as relays for its actual command and control (C2) servers, acting as an evasion mechanism.
Researchers from SonicWall discover malicious Android apps masquerading as Google, Instagram, Snapchat, WhatsApp, and X (formerly Twitter) aimed to steal users' credentials from compromised devices.
Researchers from Inky discover a phishing campaign using Rich Text Format (RTF) attachment files to harvest Microsoft credentials.
Ukraine’s military intelligence agency, the GUR, launches a DDoS attack against the website of Russia's ruling party United Russia.
The Kansas City Scout System is taken down by a cyberattack.
State officials from Lithuania and Estonia blame Russia for GPS jamming of commercial flights.
Security researchers at JFrog identify three large-scale campaigns targeting Docker Hub with repositories that did not contain container images but featured malicious metadata instead.
A new campaign distributes the Latrodectus (a.k.a. Unidentified 111 and IceNova) malware using Microsoft Azure and Cloudflare lures to appear legitimate.
Panda Restaurant Group discloses a data breach after threat actors compromised its corporate systems and stole the personal information of an undisclosed number of associates.
Researchers from Kanji discover Cuckoo, a new information stealer targeting Apple macOS systems that's designed to set up persistence on the infected hosts and act as a spyware.
